father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him,
etc. Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you, etc. John 14. 18, 19,
21, 23, 27. chapter 16. 27. chapter 17. 23.

Ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you, etc. Ye are my
friends, etc. Henceforth I call you not servants, etc. But I have called you
friends: for all things which I have heard of my father, I have made known unto
you, John 15. 7, 14, 15. 1 John 3. 22.

Christ prays for them only, not for the world, John 17. 9, 10.

Go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my father, and your
father, and to my God and your God, John 20. 17.

God is no respecter of persons; but in every nation, he who fears him, and
works righteousness, is accepted with him, Act. 10. 34, 35.

The love of God is shed abroad into our hearts by the holy Ghost, which is
given unto us, Romans 5. 5.

Sin shall not have dominion over you, because ye are not under the law, but
under grace, etc. Now being made free from sin, and become servants to God; ye
have your fruit unto holiness, and the end, everlasting life, Romans 6. 14, 22.

There is no condemnation to them who are in Christ Jesus, etc. For the law of
the spirit of life in Christ Jesus, has made me free from the law of sin and
death, etc. As many as are led by the spirit of God, are the sons of God: for
ye have not received the spirit of bondage, etc. but the spirit of adoption,
etc. And if children, then heirs, heirsof God, and joint heirs with Christ,
etc. We know that all things work together for good, to them who love God, etc.
If God be for us, who can be against us; he who spared not his own Son, etc.
How shall he not with him also freely give us all things? Who shall lay any
thing to the charge of Gods elect? is it not God who justifies? who is he that
condemns, etc? Who shall separate us from the love of Christ, etc? We are more
then Conquerors, etc. Romans 8. 1, 2, 14, 15, 16, 17, 28, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 37.
Gal. 4. 5, 6, 7.

Whosoever believes, etc. shall not be ashamed, etc. They that call upon the
name of the Lord, shall be saved, Romans 10. 11, 12, 13.

Know ye not that ye are the Temple of God, etc. Whether Paul, or Apollo, or
Cephas, or the World, or Life, or Death, or things present, or things to come,
all are ^ours, and ye are Christ's, and Christ is Gods, 1 Cor. 3. 16, 22, 23.
chap. 6. 19.

Do ye not know that the Saints shall judge the world, etc? We shall judge
Angels, how much more things which pertain unto this life? 1 Cor. 6. 2, 3.

The unbelieving husband, is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife
is sanctified by the husband, else were your children unclean, but now are they
holy, etc. He who is called in the Lord, being a servant, he is the Lords
freeman, 1 Cor. 7. 14, 22.

If any man love God, the same is known of him, 1 Cor. 8. 3.

To the glory of God by us, 2 Cor. 1. 20.

Ye are the Temple of the living God; as God has said, I will dwell in them,
and walk in them, and I will be their God, and they shall be my people, etc. I
will be a father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, says the
Lord Almighty, 2 Cor. 6. 16, 18.

Christ gave himself, etc. that he might deliver us from this present evil
world, Gal. 1. 4.

Ye are all the children of God, etc. And if Christ's, then Abraham's seed, and
heirs according to the promise, Gal. 3. 26, 29. chapter 4. 28.

And because ye are sons, God has sent forth the spirit of his son into your
hearts, crying Abba father, etc. And if a Son, then an heir of God through
Christ, Gal. 4. 6, 7.

Brethren, ye have been called unto liberty, only use not liberty for an
occasion unto the flesh, Gal. 5. 13.

Blessed be God, who has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly
things, etc. Having predestined us unto the adoption of children, etc. What
is the riches of the glory of his Inheritance in the Saints? etc. The Church,
which is the body, the fullness of him who fills all in all, Ephesians. 1. 3, 5,
18, 23.

God who is rich in mercy, and has made us to sit together in Heavenly places
in Christ Jesus, etc. We are no more strangers, etc. but fellow-Citizens with
the Saints, and of the household of God, etc. Ye are built together for a
habitation for God through the spirit, Ephesians. 2. 4, 6, 19, 22.

For me to live is Christ, and to dye is gain, Phil. 1. 21.

The peace of God which passes all understanding, shall keep your hearts and
minds through Jesus Christ, etc. The God of peace shall be with you, Phil. 4.
7, 9.

Giving thanks to the father, who has made us meet to be partakers of the
inheritance of the Saints in light: who has delivered us from the power of
darkness, and has translated us into the kingdom of his dear Son, etc. The
mystery which has been hid from ages, etc. but now is made manifest unto his
Saints; to whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this
mystery, etc. Col. 1. 12, 13, 26, 27.

Your life is hid with Christ in God, etc. The elect of God holy and beloved,
Col. 3. 3, 12.

That ye would walk worthy of God, who has called you unto his kingdom and
glory, 1 These. 2. 12.

God has not appointed us unto wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord
Jesus Christ, who dyed for us, that whether we wake or sleep, we should live
together with him, 1 These. 5. 9, 10.

Brethren, beloved of the Lord, etc. He called you by our Gospel, to the
obtaining of the glory of the Lord Jesus Christ, etc. Now our Lord Jesus Christ
himself, and God even our father who has loved us, and given us everlasting
consolation and good hope through grace, 2 These. 2. 13, 14, 16.

Godliness is profitable unto all things, having the promise of the life that
now is, and of that which is to come, etc. We trust in the living. God, who is
the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe, 1 Timothy 4. 8, 10.

Godliness with contentment is great gain, 1 Timothy 6. 6.

Unto the pure all things are pure, Tit. 1. 15.

Being justified, etc. we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal
life, Tit. 3. 7.

The angels, etc. are they not all ministring-spirits, sent forth to minister
for them who shall be heirs of salvation, Heb. 1. 13, 14.

There remains therefore a rest (or, keeping of a fabbath) unto the people of
God, etc. Heb. 4. 9. chap. 6. 19.

God is not unrighteous, to forget your work and labor of love which ye have
showed toward his name, etc. wherein God, willing more abundantly to show unto
the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath,
that by two immutable things wherein it was impossible for God to lie, we might
have strong consolation, who have fled for refuge, to lay hold upon the hope
set before us, Heb. 6. 10, 17, 18.

The excellency of the new Covenant, and the Saints privileges under it, Heb.
8. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11. chap. 10. 16, 17, 18, 19.

Others had trials of cruel mockings and scourgings, etc. of whom the world was
not worthy, Heb. 11. 36, 37, 38.

Ye are come unto Mount Sion, and unto the City of the living God, the heavenly
Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels, to the general assembly and
church of the firstborn, who are written (or, enrolled) in heaven, and to God
the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect, and to Jesus,
etc. and to the blood of sprinkling which speaks, etc. Heb. 12. 22, 23, 24.

A crown of life, which the Lord has promised to them who love him, James 1.
12.

Has not God chosen the poor of this world, rich in faith, and heirs of the
kingdom, which he has promised unto them who love him, James 2. 5.

The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much. Elias was a man
subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not
rain, and it rained not, etc. and he prayed again, and the heavens gave rain,
and the earth brought forth her fruit, James 5. 16, 17, 18.

Blessed be God, etc. who, etc. has begotten us to a lively hope by the
resurrection of Jesus, etc. 1 Pet. 1. 3.

Ye also as lively stones are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood,
to offer up spiritual sacrifice acceptable to God by Jesus Christ, etc. ye are
a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a peculiar (or, a
purchased) people, that ye should show forth the praise (or, virtues), etc. 1
Pet. 2. 5, 9. Rev. 1. 6. Rev. 5. 10.

Ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing, etc. The eyes of
the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayer, 1
Pet. 3. 9, 12.

Casting all your care upon him, for he cares for you, 1 Pet. 5. 7.

According to his divine power has given us all things which pertain to life
and godliness, etc. whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious
promises, that by these you might be partakers of the divine nature, etc. so an
entrance shall be administered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom
of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, 2 Pet. 1. 3, 4, 11.

The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation, 2 Pet. 2. 9.

Truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ, 1 John
1. 3.

We have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous, etc. he who
does the will of God, abides for ever, etc. ye have an unction from the holy
one, and ye know all things, 1 John 2. 1, 17, 20.

Behold what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us, that we should be
called the sons of God, etc. Beloved, now we are the sons of God, and it does
not yet appear what we shall be, 1 John 3. 1, 2.

Ye are of God, etc. greater is he who is in you, than he who is in the world,
1 John 4. 4.

This is the confidence that we have in him, that if we ask any thing according
to his will, he hears us, 1 John 5. 14.

The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him to show unto his
servants things which must shortly come to pass, etc. he has made us kings,
etc. Rev. 1. 1, 6.

Hurt not the earth, etc. till we have sealed the servants of God in their
foreheads, Rev. 7. 2, 3.

And it was commanded them they should not hurt, etc. but only those men who
have not the seal of God in their foreheads, Rev. 9. 4.

The Lamb shall overcome them, etc. and they who are with him, are called, and
chosen, and faithful, Rev. 17. 14.

See the advantage of faith, Chap. 11.

See more of their privileges in afflictions and persecutions, Chap. 22.

In common calamities, Chap. 23.

In the glory believers shall have, Chap. 36.

In the next Chapter, of their relation to Christ.

CHAP. XV. The Union and Relations between Christ and his Church; and the
mutual love and esteem each of other, and the manifestation thereof.
I Will declare thy name unto my brethren, etc. Psalm. 22. 22.

Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than
wine, etc. Thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the Virgins love
thee. Tell me, O thou, whom my soul loves, where thou feedest, etc. For why
should I be as one who turns aside by the flocks of thy companions? If thou
know not (O thou fairest among women) go, etc. A bundle of myrrh is my beloved
unto me, he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts, etc. Behold thou art fair
my love, etc. Cant. 1. 2, 3, 7, 8, 13, 15, 16.

As the Lilly among thorns, so is my love among the daughters; as the
Apple Tree among the trees of the wood, so my beloved among the sons. I sat
down (or delighted and sat down) under his shadow with great delight, and his
fruit sweet, etc. I am sick of love, his left hand under my head, and his right
hand does embrace me, etc. O my dove, let me see thy countenance, let me hear
thy voice: for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely, Cant. 2. 1,
2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 14.

By night on my bed, I sought him whom my soul loves, I sought him, but I
found him not. I will rise now, and go about the City, etc. I will seek him
whom my soul loves, etc. Saw ye whom my soul loves? I found him, etc. I held
him and would not let him go, Cant. 3. 1, 2, 3, 4.

Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee; come with me, etc. Thou
have ravished (or taken away) my heart, my sister, spouse: thou have ravished
my heart with one of thine eyes, etc. How fair is thy love, my sister, spouse?
how much better is thy love than wine, etc? A garden enclosed is my sister,
etc. Let my beloved come into his garden, etc. Cant. 4. 7, 9, 10, 12, 16.

It is the voice of my beloved who knocks, saying, open to me my sister, my
love, my dove, my und^filed, etc. I opened to my beloved, but my beloved had
withdrawn himself, was gone, my soul failed when he spoke; I sought him, but
could not find: I called him, but he gave me no answer, etc. Tell him I am sick
of love, etc. My beloved is, etc. He is altogether lovely, Cant. 5. 2, 6, 10,
16.

I am my beloveds, and my beloved is mine, etc. Thou beautiful, O my love, etc.
my dove, my undefiled, etc. Who is she who looks forth as the morning, fair
as the moon, clear as the sun? Cant. 6. 3, 4, 9, 10.

I am my beloveds, and his desire is toward me, Cant. 7. 10.

Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is
strong as death, Cant. 8. 6.

Behold, I, and the children whom the Lord has given me, Isaiah 8. 18. Heb. 2.
13.

Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye
have done it unto me, etc. When saw we thee an hungry, etc. and did not
minister, etc? Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did
it not to me, Matt. 25. 34, 35, 40, 45.

Go tell my brethren, that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me,
Matt. 28. 10.

He who eats my flesh, and drinks my blood, dwells in me, and I in him,
John 6. 56.

I am the good shepherd, the good shepherd gives his life for the sheep, etc.
I, etc. know my sheep, and am known of mine, John 10. 11, 14.

I am glad for your sakes that I was not there (to the intent ye may believe)
John 11. 14, 15.

Ye call me master and Lord, and ye say well: for so I am, John. 13. 13.

Let not you hearts be troubled, etc. I will come again, and receive you to my
self, that where I am, there ye may be also, etc. Ye see me; because I live, ye
shall live also, etc. You in me, and I in you, etc. Peace I leave with you,
etc. Let not your hearts be troubled, John 14. 1, 3, 19, 20, 27.

I am the vine, ye are the branches, etc. As the father has loved me, so have
I loved you: continue ye in my love, etc. These things have I spoken unto you,
that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full, etc. I have
loved you; greater love has no man than this, that a man lay down his life for
his friends, John 15. 5, 9, 11, 12, 13. Luke 12. 4.

These things have I spoken, that ye should not be offended, etc. I will see
you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man takes from you,
John 16. 1, 22.

Christ prays for his Church at large, John 17.

Go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my father, and your
father, to my God, and to your God, John 20. 17.

Jesus said, feed my sheep, feed my lambs, John 21. 15, 16, 17.

When Saul persecuted the Church, Christ said unto him, why persecutes thou me,
etc. I am Jesus whom thou persecutest, Act. 9. 4, 5.

Ye are become dead unto the Law, etc. That ye should be married unto another,
even to him who is raised from the dead, Romans 7. 4. chapter 14. 9.

Thou bear not the root, but the root thee, Romans 11. 17.

Ye are Christ's, 1 Cor. 3. 23.

Know you not that your bodies are the members of Christ, etc. He who is joined
unto the Lord is one spirit, 1 Cor. 6. 15, 17.

When ye sin so against the brethren, ye sin against Christ, 1 Cor. 8. 12.

The head of every man is Christ, 1 Cor. 11. 3.

All the members of that one body being many, are one body, so also is Christ,
etc. For by one spirit are we all baptized into one body, 1 Cor. 12. 12, 13.
Gal. 3. 28.

The love of Christ constrains us, 2 Cor. 5. 14.

I have espoused you unto one husband, that I may present you a chaste Virgin to
Christ, 2 Cor. 11. 2.

Gave him to be the head over all things to the Church, which is the body, the
fullness of him who fills all in all, Ephesians. 1. 22, 23. Col. 1. 18.

To know the love of Christ which passes knowledge, Ephesians. 3. 19.

Grow up into him in all things, who is the head Christ, from whom the whole
body fitly joined together and compacted, etc. Ephesians. 4. 15, 16.

Christ has loved us, and given himself for us an offering, etc. Christ is the
head of the Church, and the savior of the body, etc. Christ loved the Church,
and gave himself for it, that he might sanctify and cleanse it, etc. that he
might present it to himself a glorious Church, not having spot or wrinckle,
etc. No man ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, even as
the Lord the Church: for we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his
bones, Ephesians. 5. 2, 23, 25, 26, 27, 29, 30.

I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with
Christ, which is far better, Phil. 1. 23.

What things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ; yea doubtless, I
count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my
Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but
dung that I may win Christ, Phil. 3. 7, 8.

Not holding the head, from which all the body by joints and bands having
nourishment ministered, and knit together, increases with the increase of God,
Col. 2. 18, 19.

Both he who sanctifies, and they who are sanctified, are all of one: for
which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren: Saying, I will declare thy
name, etc. Heb. 2. 11, 12.

Christ as a son over his own house, whose house are we, if we hold fast, etc.
Heb. 3. 6.

Unto you who believe, he is precious, etc. 1 Pet. 2. 7.

Jesus Christ, etc. who loved us and washed us, etc. Rev. 1. 5.

CHAP. XVI. Of the Duties of Believers, such as profess to be Saints.
First, Toward God.
In the general, to live to God, not to themselves; to be holy fruitful,
walking in the light, in an honest, heavenly, and spiritual conversation,
worthy of their high calling; Glorify God, and mind things above.
ENoch walked with God, Genesis 5. 22, 24.

Noah walked with God, Genesis 6. 9.

And the Lord said unto Noah, come thou, etc. For thee have I seen righteous
before me in this generation, etc. And Noah did according unto all that the
Lord had commanded him, Genesis 7. 1, 5.

I am the Lord your God: ye shall therefore sanctify your selves, ye shall be
holy, for I am holy, Levit. 11. 44, 45. chapter 19. 2.

Seek not after your own heart, etc. But be ye holy unto your God, etc. Number.
15. 39, 40.

Thou art an holy people to the Lord, etc. Thou shall not eat any abominable
thing, Deuteronomy. 14. 2, 3.

Behold, all souls are mine: as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the
son is mine, the soul which sins it shall dye, Ezekiel. 18. 4.

Israel is an empty vine, he brings forth fruit unto himself, Hosea 10. 1.

Is it time for you, O ye, to dwell in your ceiled houses, and this house lie
waste? etc. Ye have sown much, and brought in little, etc. Why, says the Lord
of hosts? because of mine house that is waste; and ye run every man to his own
house, therefore, etc. Haggai 1. 4, 6, 9, 10.

Bring forth therefore fruit meet for repentance, etc. The Axe is laid unto the
root of the trees: therefore every tree which bring forth not fruit, is hewn
down, and cast into the fire, Matt. 3. 8, 10. Luke 3. 8.

Let your lights so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and
glorify your father which is in heaven, Matt. 5. 16.

Lay up for your selves treasure in heaven, etc. For where your treasure is,
there will your hearts be also, Matt. 6. 20, 21.

A good man out of the good treasure of the heart, brings forth good things,
Matt. 12. 35.

They are to improve their Talents. See the Parable, Matt. 25. 14, etc.

Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find
none, cut it down, why cumbreth it the ground, etc? Strive to enter in at the
strait gate, Luke 13. 7, 24.

When ye have done all those things which are commanded you, say, we are
unprofitable servants, we have done that which was our duty to do, Luke 17, 10.

In every nation, he that fears God, and works righteousness, is accepted
of him, Act. 10. 35.

Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you, John 12. 35.

Ye call me Master, and Lord, and ye say well: for so I am, John 13. 13.

Every branch in me that bears not fruit, he takes away; and every branch
that bears fruit, he purges it, that it may bring forth more fruit, etc.
Herein is my father glorified, that ye bring forth much fruit, etc. I have
chosen you, and ordained you, that you should go and bring forth fruit, and
that your fruit should remain, John 15. 2, 8, 16.

Herein do I exercise my self, to have always a conscience void of offense,
toward God, and toward men, Acts 24. 16.

We also should walk in newness of life, etc. Yield your selves unto God, as
those who are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of
righteousness unto God, etc. Know ye not, that to whom ye yield your selves
servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey: whether of sin unto
death, or obedience unto righteousness? Romans 6. 4, 13, 16.

Ye also are become dead unto the Law, etc. that we should bring forth fruit
unto God, etc. That we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in the
oldness of the letter, Romans 7. 4, 6.

We are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh: for if ye live
after the flesh, ye shall dye; but if ye through the spirit mortify the deeds
of the body, ye shall live, Romans 8. 12, 13.

I beseech you brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a
living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, your reasonable service; and be
not conformed unto this world, but be ye transformed by the renewing of your
mind, that ye may prove what is that good, that acceptable will of God, etc.
Provide things honest in the sight of all men, Romans 12. 1, 2, 17. Ephesians. 5. 10.

It is high time to awake out of sleep, etc. The night is far spent, the day is
at hand: Let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the
armor of light. Let us walk honestly as in the day, not in rioting and
drunkenness, etc. But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision
for the flesh, to fulfill the lusts thereof, Romans 13. 11, 12, 13, 14.

None of us lives to himself, and no man dies to himself: for whether we
live, we live unto the Lord, etc. Whether we live therefore, or dye, we are the
Lords, etc. Righteousness and peace, etc. For he who in these things serves
Christ, is acceptable to God, and approved of men, Romans 14. 7, 8, 9, 17, 18.

I would have you wise to that which is good, and simple concerning evil, Romans
16. 19.

The body is not for fornication, but for the Lord, etc. Your bodies are the
members of Christ, etc. And ye are not your own: for ye are bought with a
Price: Therefore glorify God in your bodies, and in your spirit, which are
Gods, 1 Cor. 6. 13, 15, 19, 20. chap. 3. 16, 17.

Be ye steadfast, etc. always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as
you know, that your labor is not in vain in the Lord, 1 Cor. 15. 58.

Whether therefore ye eat or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of
God, 1 Cor. 10. 31.

Wherefore we endeavor (or labor) that whether present, or absent, we may be
accepted of him, etc. The love of Christ constrains us, because we thus judge,
that if one dyed for all, then were all dead, etc. That they who live, should
not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him who dyed for them, 2 Cor. 5.
9, 14, 15.

Having therefore these promises (dearly beloved) let us cleanse our selves
from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of
God, 2 Cor. 7. 1.

Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but in the
sight of men, 2 Cor. 8. 20.

Be not deceived, God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man sows, that shall he
also reap: for he who sows to the flesh, shall of the flesh reap corruption:
But he who sows to the spirit, shall of the spirit reap life, etc. Gal. 6. 7,
8. chapter 5. 16.

According as he has chosen us in him, etc. that we should be holy, and
without blame, before him in love, Ephesians. 1. 4.

Created, etc. unto good works which God has foreordained, that we should walk
in them, Ephesians. 2. 10.

I therefore, etc. beseech you, that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith
ye are called, etc. This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that ye
henceforth walk not as other Gentiles in the vanity of their mind, etc. But ye
have not so learned Christ, etc. That ye put off concerning the former
conversation, the old man which is corrupt according to deceitful lusts: And be
renewed in the spirit of your minds; and that ye put on that new man, which
after God, is created in righteousness, and true holiness, Ephesians. 4. 1, 17, 20,
22, 23, 24. Col. 3. 9, 10.

Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children, etc. Ye were sometimes
darkness, but now light in the Lord: Walk as children of the light, etc. Have
no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them,
etc. See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, redeeming the time,
Ephesians. 5. 1, 8, 11, 15, 16.

That ye may approve things which differ (or try things which are excellent)
that ye be sincere, and without offense, till the day of Christ, etc. Being
filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the
glory and praise of God, etc. According to my earnest expection, etc. Christ
shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death, etc. Let your
conversation be as becomes the Gospel of Christ, Phil. 1. 10, 11, 20, 27.

Work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, etc. That ye be blameless
and harmless, the sons of God without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and
perverse nation, among whom ye shine (or shine ye) as lights in the world, etc.
All seek their own things, not the things of Jesus Christ, Phil. 2. 12, 15, 21.

Brethren, be ye followers of me, and mark them who walk so, as ye have us for
an ensample: for many walk, of whom I have told you, etc. even weeping, the
enemies of the cross of Christ, etc. who mind earthly things: for our
conversation is in heaven, Phil. 3. 17, 18, 19, 20.

Finally brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things honest,
whatsoever things just, whatsoever things pure, whatsoever things lovely,
whatsoever things of good report: if there be any virtue, and if there be any
praise, think on these things. Those things which ye have both learned, and
received, and heard, and seen in me, do, etc. Phil. 4. 8, 9.

That ye might walk worthy of the Lord, unto all pleasing, being fruitful in
every good work, Col. 1. 10.

If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, etc. Set
your affections on things above, not on things on the earth, etc. Mortify
therefore your members which are upon earth, fornication, etc. Col. 3. 1, 2, 5.

Walk in wisdom toward them who are without, redeeming the time, etc. That ye
may stand perfect, and complete in all the will of God, etc. Col. 4. 5, 12.

That ye would walk worthy of God, who h^h called you unto his kingdom, 1 These.
2. 12.

We exhort you, by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us, how ye ought
to walk, and to please God; so ye would abound more and more, etc. For this is
the will of God, your sanctification, etc. That every one of you should know
how to possess his vessel in sanctification, and honor, etc. For God has not
called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness, 1 These. 4. 1, 3, 4, 7.

Now the very God of peace sanctify you wholly, and your whole spirit, and
soul, and body be preserved blameless, unto the coming of our Lord, 1 These. 5.
23.

Exercise thy self to godliness, etc. Godliness is profitable to all things,
have promise of this, etc. 1 Timothy 4. 7, 8.

Thou, O man of God, etc. Follow after righteousness, godliness, etc. 1 Timothy 6.
6, 11.

Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 22.

For the grace of God that brings salvation, etc. teaching us, that denying
ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly
in this present world, Titus 2. 11, 12.

Put them in mind, etc. to be ready to every good work, etc. A faithful saying,
and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have
believed in God, might be careful to maintain good works, Titus 3. 1, 8.

Let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which does so easily beset us, and
let us run with patience the race that is set before us, etc. Follow peace,
etc. and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord, Heb. 12. 1, 14.

Who is a wise man, etc? Let him show out of a good conversation, his works
with meekness of wisdom, James 3. 13.

As obedient children, not fashioning your selves according to the former
lusts, in your ignorance: but as he who has called you is holy, so be ye holy
in all manner of conversation; because it is written, Be ye holy, for I am
holy, 1 Pet. 1. 14, 15.

Ye are a chosen generation, etc. that ye should show forth the praises of him
who has called you, etc. Abstain from fleshly lusts which war against the
soul, having your conversation honest amongst the Gentiles, that whereas (or
wherein) they speak against you, as evil doers, they may by your good works
which they behold, glorify God in the day of visitation, etc. We being dead
unto sin, should live unto righteousness, Matt. 5. 16. 1 Pet. 2. 9, 11, 12, 15,
24. 1 Timothy 5. 14. Titus 2. 5, 10.

Let him eschew evil, and do good, etc. Who is he who will harm you, if you be
followers of that which is good, etc? Sanctify the Lord in your hearts, and he
always ready to give an answer to every man who asks you a reason of the hope
that is in you, with meekness and fear; having a good conscience, that whereas
they speak evil of you, as of evil doers, they may be ashamed who falsely accuse
your good conversation in Christ, 1 Pet. 3. 11, 13, 15, 16.

The time past of our life may ^uffice us to have wrought the will of the
Gentiles, etc. 1 Pet. 4. 2, 3.

Giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue, and to virtue knowledge, and
to knowledge temperance, etc. godliness, etc. Give diligence to make your
calling and election sure, 2 Pet. 1. 5, 6, 10.

Seeing that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought
ye to be, in all holy conversation and godliness, etc? Wherefore beloved,
seeing ye loo for such things, be diligent, that ye may be found of him in
peace without spot or blemish, 2 Pet. 3. 11, 14.

God is light, etc. If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in
darkness, we lie, and do not the truth; but if we walk in the light, as he is
in the light, etc. 1 John 1. 5, 6, 7.

He who says he abides in him, ought himself also so to walk, even as he
walked, 1 John 2. 6.

Every man who has this hope in him, purifieth himself, even as he is pure,
etc. He who does righteousness, is righteous, even as he is righteous, 1 John
3. 7.

Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good: he who does
good is of God, but he who does evil has not seen God, 3 John v. 11.

In Particular. 1st, To love God, and the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ.
In The Lord thy God, etc. showing mercy unto thousands of them who love me,
Exodus 20. 6.

The Lord our God, one Lord. And thou shall love the Lord thy God, with all
thine heart, with all thy soul, and with all thy might, Deuteronomy. 6. 4, 5.

The Lord thy God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and mercy
with them who love him, Deuteronomy. 7. 9.

And now Israel, what does God require of thee, but, etc. to love him, and to
serve the Lord thy God, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul? Deuteronomy. 10. 12.

Therefore thou shall love the Lord thy God, etc. If you shall hearken, etc. to
love the Lord your God, and to serve him with all your heart, etc. that I will,
etc. Deuteronomy. 11. 1, 13.

The Lord your God proves you, to know whether ye love the Lord your God, with

toward thy holy temple, (or the Temple of thy holiness) Psalm. 5. 7.

Who is God save the Lord! Psalm. 18. 31.

All the ends of the world shall remember, and return unto the Lord, and all
the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee: for the kingdom is the
Lords, and he the governor among the nations. All they who are fat on earth,
shall eat and worship, etc. A seed shall serve him, Psalm. 22. 27, 28, 29, 30.

I will wash my hands in innocence, so will I compass thine altar, O Lord, etc.
I have loved the habitation of thy house, and the place where thine honor
dwells, Psalm. 26. 6, 8.

Give unto the Lord the glory due unto (or, the honor of) his name: worship
the Lord in the beauty of holiness (or, in his glorious sanctuary), Psalm. 29.
2. Psalm. 96. 4, 6, 7, 8, 9.

For he is thy Lord, and worship thou him, Psalm. 45. 11.

All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee, etc. Psalm. 66. 4.
Psalm. 63. 1, 2, 3, etc.

Neither shall thou worship any strange God, I the Lord thy God, Psalm. 81. 9,
10.

How amiable are thy tabernacles, etc! my soul longs, etc. a day in thy
courts is better, etc. Psalm. 84. 1, 2, etc.

I will call upon thee among the gods; none like unto thee, O Lord; neither are
there any works like unto thy works: all nations whom thou have made, shall
come and worship before thee, O Lord, and shall glorify thy name; for thou art
great, and do wonderful things: thou art God alone, Psalm. 86. 7, 8, 9, 10.
Rev. 15. 4.

For who in heaven can be compared unto the Lord? Who among the sons of the
mighty can be likened unto the Lord? God is greatly to be feared in the
assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them about him, Psalm.
89, 6, 7.

Before the mountains were, etc. even from everlasting to everlasting thou art
God, Psalm. 90. 2.

The Lord is great, and a great King above all gods, etc. O come let us worship
and bow down; let us kneel before the Lord our Maker; for he is our God, and we
are the people of his pasture, Psalm. 95. 3, 6, 7.

The Lord reigns, etc. worship him all ye gods, etc. for thou Lord art high
above all the earth; thou art exalted far above all gods, Psalm. 97. 1, 7, 9.

Exalt ye the Lord our God, and worship at his footstool, he is holy, Psalm. 99,
5, 9.

Holy and reverend is his name, Psalm. 111. 9.

I will worship toward his holy temple, Psalm. 138. 2.

Keep thy foot when thou go to the house of God; and be more ready to hear,
than to give the sacrifice of fools, etc. Be not rash with thy mouth and let
not thy heart be hasty to utter any thing (or, word) before God: for, God in
heaven, and thou upon earth; therefore let thy words be few, Eccles. 5. 1, 2.

Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, etc. to whom then will
ye liken God? or what, etc? Isa. 40. 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18.

I am the Lord, that is my name; and my glory will I not give unto another,
Isa. 42. 8.

That ye may know and believe me, and understand that I am he: before me there
was no God formed (or nothing formed of God), neither shall there be after me.
I the Lord, and besides me no Savior. I have declared, and have saved, and I
have showed when there no God among you: Therefore ye my witnesses, says the
Lord, that I am God; yea, before the day I am he; and there is none who can
deliver out of my hand. I will work, and who shall let it? Thus says the Lord,
your Redeemer the Holy One of Israel, etc. But thou have not called upon me, O
Jacob, Isa. 43, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 22.

Thus says the Lord, the King of Israel, and his redeemer, the Lord of Hosts:
I am the first, and I the last, and besides me no God, etc. Ye are my
witnesses, is there a God besides me? yea, no God, I know not any, etc. Thus
says the Lord, etc. I am the Lord who makes all things, who stretches forth
the heavens alone, who spreads abroad the earth by my self, etc. Isa. 44. 6,
8, 24. Psalm. 96. 5.

I am the Lord, and none else; no God besides me: I girded thee, though thou
have not known me. That they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the
west, that there is none besides me. I am the Lord, and none else, I form the
light, and create darkness; I make peace, and create evil: I the Lord do all
these things, etc. Thus says the Lord who created the heavens, God himself who
formed the earth, and made it, he has established it, etc. I am the Lord, and
there is none else, Isa. 45. 5, 6, 7, 18, 21, 22.

I am God, and there is none besides me; I am God, and none like me, declaring
the end from the beginning; and from ancient times the things which are not
done; saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure, Isa. 46.
9, 10. chap. 41. 4.

But the Lord is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king;
at his wrath the earth shall tremble, etc. he has made the earth by his power,
he has established the world by his wisdom, and has stretched out the heavens
by his discretion, when he utters his voice, etc. Jer. 10. 10, 12, 13. Heb.
9. 14.

Yet I am the Lord thy God, and thou shall know no God but me: for there is no
savior besides me, Hosea 13. 4. Isa. 37. 20.

I hate, I despise your feasts, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies,
etc. But let judgment run down, etc. Amos 5. 21, 22, 23, 24.

And it shall come to pass, that every one who is least of all the Nations
which came against Jerusalem, shall even go up from year to year to worship the
King the Lord of Host, etc. Zech. 14. 16.

If then I be a father, where is mine honor, etc. And if ye offer the blind
and the lame, etc. offer it now unto your governor, will he be pleased with
thee, or accept thy person, etc? ye brought that which was torn, and the lame,
and the sick; thus ye brought an offering: should I accept this at your hand,
says the Lord? But cursed the deceiver, who has in his flock a male, and
voweth and sacrifices unto God a corrupt thing: for I am a great king, says
the Lord of hosts, and my name is dreadful among the heathen, Mal. 1. 6, 8, 13,
14.

Get thee behind me Satan, for it is written: thou shall worship the Lord thy
God, and him only shall thou serve, Matt. 4. 10.

Where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst
of them, Matt. 18. 20.

There is one God, and there is none other but he, Mark. 12. 32.

Our fathers worshipped in this mountain, and ye say that in Jerusalem is the
place where men ought to worship, etc. The hour comes, when ye shall neither
in this mountain, nor at Jerusalem worship the father, ye worship ye know not
what, etc. but the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers shall
worship the father in spirit and in truth: for the father seeks such to
worship him. God is a spirit, and they who worship him, must worship him in
spirit and in truth, John 4. 20, 21, 22, 23, 24.

The father himself, etc. ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen
his shape, John 5. 37. Exodus 33. 20.

And he said, Lord I believe, and he worshipped him, John 9. 38.

The most high dwells not in temples made with hands, etc. Heaven is my
throne, etc. has not my hands made all, etc? Act. 7. 48, 49, 50.

Whom ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you. God who made the world and
all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwells not in
temples made with hands: neither is worshipped with men's hands, as though he
needed any thing, seeing he gave to all life, and breath, and all things, and
has made of one blood, all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the
earth, and has determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their
habitations, etc. Acts 17. 24, 25, 26.

After the way they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, Act. 24.
14.

God whom I serve with my spirit, etc. The invisible things of him from the
creation of the world, are clearly seen, being understood by the things which
are made, his eternal power and godhead: so that they are without excuse;
because that when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, etc. but became
vain, etc. Changed the truth of God into a lie, and served and worshipped the
creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever, Amen, Romans 1. 9, 20,
21, 23, 25. 2 Timothy 1. 3.

Not slothful in business, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord, Romans 12. 11.

We know that an Idol is nothing in the world, and there is none other God but
one. For though there be that are called Gods, etc. but to us there is but one
God the father, of whom are all things, and we in (or for) him; and one Lord
Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him, 1 Cor. 8. 4, 5, 6. 1 Timothy
2. 5.

So falling down on his face, he will worship God, and report that God is in
you of a truth, 1 Cor. 14. 25.

We are the circumcision, who worship God in the spirit, Phil. 3. 3.

When he brings in the first begotten into the world, he says, and let all
the Angels of God worship him, Heb. 1. 6.

God, etc. because he could swear by no greater, he swear by himself, etc. The
living God, etc. Heb. 6. 13. chapter 9. 14.

Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace (or
hold fast) whereby we may serve God acceptably; with reverence and godly fear:
for our God is a consuming fire, Heb. 12. 28; 29.

Ye also as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, a holy priesthood,
to offer up spiritual sacrifice, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ, 1 Pet. 2. 5.

No man has seen God at any time, 1 John 4. 12.

Fear God, and give glory unto him, etc. And worship him who made heaven and
earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters, Rev. 14. 7. chap. 15. 4.

Worship God, Rev. 19. 10. chap. 22. 9.

Sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, 1 Pet. 3. 15.

See more of Idolatry, and worshipping strange Gods, etc. Chap. 39.

See the order of Public worship, Ordinances, Officers, etc. Chap. 27.

Believe, embrace, and be found in the practice of nothing, in the things of
God, and about his worship, but that which clearly (according to Precepts,
Rules, and Examples of the Scriptures) appears to be Christ's mind, upon which
we can in faith expect acceptance.
And Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord, and all the
judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words
which the Lord has said, will we do. And Moses wrote all the words of the
Lord; etc. And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of
the people, and they said, All that the Lord has said, will we do, and be
obedient, Exodus 24. 2, 4, 7.

And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them: according unto
all that I show thee, after the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of
all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make, Exodus 25. 8, 9.

In the tabernacle without the vail, which is before the testimony, Aaron and
his sons shall order it from evening till morning before the Lord, etc. Exodus
27. 21.

And these are the garments which they shall make, a breast plate, etc. And
they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that they
may minister unto me in the Priests office, etc. Exodus 28. 4, 5, 8, etc.

They made the holy garments for Aaron, as the Lord commanded Moses, Exodus 39.
1.

Thus did Moses: according unto all that the Lord commanded him, so did he,
etc. he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, etc. as the Lord commanded
Moses, etc. And he lighted the lamps before the Lord, as the Lord commanded
Moses, etc. When they came near unto the Altar, they washed as the Lord
commanded Moses, Exodus 40. 16, 19, 21, 23, 25, 27, 29. Levit. 8. 4, 5, 36.

Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, etc. offered strange fire which he
commanded them not, and there went out fire from the Lord, and devoured them,
and they dyed before the Lord. And Moses said unto Aaron, This is that the Lord
spoke, I will be sanctified in them who come nigh me, and before all the
people, etc. Levit. 10. 1, 2, 3.

After the doings of the Land of Egypt, etc. and after the doings of the Land
of Canaan, etc. shall ye not do: neither shall ye walk in their ordinances. Ye
shall do my judgments, and keep my ordinances to walk therein: I am the Lord
your God, Levit. 18. 3, 4.

And they kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the first month, at even,
in the wilderness of Sinai: according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so
did the children of Israel, etc. They shall leave none of it, etc. according to
all the ordinances of the passover, they shall keep it, Number. 9. 5, 12. Levit.
19. 5, 6.

Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall you, etc.
Deuteronomy. 4. 2.

Ye shall utterly destroy all the places wherein the nations which ye shall
possess, served their gods, etc. ye shall not do so unto the Lord your God; but
unto the place the Lord your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his
name there; unto his habitation shall ye seek, and thither shall thou come, and
thither ye shall bring your burnt-offerings, etc. and ye shall not do, etc.
every man what is right in his own eyes, etc. When you go over Jordan, etc.
then there shall be a place which the Lord your God shall choose to cause his
name to dwell there, thither shall ye bring all that I command you, your
burnt-offerings, etc. Take heed to thy self, that thou be not snared by
following them, etc. And that thou enquire not after their gods, saying, how
did these nations serve their gods? even so will I do likewise. Thou shall not
do so unto the Lord thy God, etc. Whatsoever thing I command you, observe to do
it: thou shall not add thereunto, nor diminish from it, Deuteronomy. 12. 2, 3, 4, 5,
6, 8, 10, 11, 13, 14, 30, 31, 32.

Secret things belong unto the Lord our God; but those things which are
revealed, belong unto us, and to our children for ever, that we may do all the
words of this law, Deuteronomy. 29. 29.

Jeroboam ordained a feast, etc. like unto the feast in Judah, etc. upon the
month which he had devised in his own heart, 1 Kings 12. 32, 33. 2 Kings 17. 8.

Be not righteous overmuch, neith^ make thy self over wise, Eccles. 7. 16.

To the law and to the testimony: if they speak not according to this word, it

The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof: because they have

And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is

Thus says the Lord, stand ye in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths,

The place of my throne, etc. shall the house of Israel no more defile, neither

Son of man, mark well, etc. all that I say unto thee concerning all the
ordinances of the house of the Lord, and all the laws thereof, etc. And thou

uncircumcised in heart, etc. to pollute it, even my house, when ye offer my

keepers of my charge (or ordinance) in my sanctuary, for your selves, Ezekiel. 44.
5, 6, 7, 8, 9.

Why do you transgress the commandments of God by your traditions? for God

Where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst

Teach them to observe all things, whatsoever I have commanded you, Matt. 28.
20. Act. 10. 33.

When Paul, according to advice, had observed some Jewish ceremonies, the Jews
came upon him, and laid hold on him; the very thing his advisers proposed to
prevent by it, Act. 21. 20, 21, 22, 23, etc.

After the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers,
believing all things which are written in the law and the prophets, Acts 24. 14.

That ye may prove what is that good, that acceptable will of God, Romans 12. 2.
Ephesians. 5. 10, 17.

He who doubts is damned, if he eat, because not of faith: for whatsoever is
not of faith, is sin, Romans 14. 23.

Now I praise you, brethren, that you, etc. keep the ordinances (or traditions)
as I delivered them unto you, etc. For I have received of the Lord, that which
also I delivered unto you, that the Lord Jesus the same night, etc. 1 Cor. 11.
1, 2, 23.

If we, or an Angel from heaven preach unto you, other than that which we have
preached, etc. let him be accursed, Gal. 1. 8.

Ye did run well, who did hinder you (or turn you back)? this persuasion comes
not of him who called you, Gal. 5. 7, 8.

That we henceforth be no more children tossed to and fro, and carried about
with every wind of doctrine, by the slight of men, and cunning craftiness, etc.
Ephesians. 4. 14.

Those things which ye have learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me,
do, Philip. 4. 9.

Beware lest any man spoil you through Philosophy and vain deceit, after the
tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, etc. If ye be dead with
Christ, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances? touch
not, taste not, handle not; which all are to perish with the using, after the
commandments and doctrine of men: which things have indeed a show of wisdom in
will worship, Col. 2. 8, 20, 21, 22, 23.

We beseech you brethren, and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have
received of us how ye ought to walk, and to please God, so ye would abound,
etc. 1 These. 4. 1.

Prove all things, hold fast that which is good, 1 These. 5. 21.

Therefore brethren stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been
taught, whether by word, or our Epistle, 2 These. 2. 15.

Hold fast the form of sound words which thou have heard of me, 2 Timothy 1. 13.

Continue thou in the things which thou have learned, and have been assured of,
knowing of whom thou have learned. And that from a Child thou have known the
holy scriptures, etc. 2 Timothy 3. 14, 15.

Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men who turn from the
truth, Titus 1. 14.

Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have
heard, lest at any time we should let them slip, Heb. 2. 1.

Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning, 1 John
2. 24.

It was needful for me to write unto you, and exhort you that you should
earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints: for
there are certain men crept in, etc. Jude verse. 3, 4.

The children of Israel had sinned against the Lord their God, etc. And had
walked in the statutes of the heathen whom, etc. and of the kings of Israel
which they had made, etc. Also Judah kept not the commandments of the Lord
their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made, 2 Kings 17. 7,
8, 18, 19.

That which is highly esteemed amongst men, is abomination in the sight of God,
Luke 16. 15.

Some affirm that we say, Let us do evil that good may come: whose damnation is
just, Romans 3. 8.

To Pray unto God: of Prayer at large.
Abraham prayed for Abimelech unto God, and God healed him and his, Genesis 20. 17.

O Lord God of master Abraham, I pray thee send me good speed this day, etc.
Let it come to pass that the damosel to whom I shall say, etc. Genesis 24. 12, 13,
14, 15.

And Isaac entreated the Lord for his wife, because she was barren, and the
Lord was entreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived, Genesis 25. 21.

Jacob prayed unto God, in his distress about Esau, and prevailed, Genesis 32. 9,
10, 11, 12, 24, 25, 26, 28. chapter 33. 4. Hosea 12. 4, 5.

Moses prayed unto God for Pharaoh, to remove their Plagues, Exodus 8. 12, 13.
chapter 9. 33. chapter 10. 18.

Moses prayed hard and often for Israel, and prevailed, Exodus 32. 11, 12, 13,
14, 31, 32. Number. 14. 13, to the 20.

The forms Moses and Aaron, and his sons used in blessing the people, and in
their march, Number. 6. 23, 24, 25, 26. chap. 10. 35, 36.

I besought the Lord at that time, saying, O Lord God, thou have begun to show
thy servant, etc. Deuteronomy. 3. 23, 24, etc.

If from thence thou shall seek the Lord thy God, thou shall find him, if thou
seek him with all thy heart, etc. Deuteronomy. 4. 29.

Joshua prayed when Israel had fled before the men of Ai, Joshua 7: 6, 7, 8, 9.

Then Manoah entreated the Lord, and said, O my Lord, let the man of God whom
thou did send, come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the
child, etc. And God hearkened unto the voice of Manoah, Judges 13. 8, 9.

Sampson called on the Lord, and said, Thou have given this great deliverance
into the hands of thy servant, and now shall I dye for thirst? and God clave an
hollow place that was in the jaw, and there came water thereout, Judges 15. 18,
19.

And Sampson called unto the Lord, and said, O Lord God, remember me, I pray
thee, and strengthen me, I pray thee, only this once, O God, etc. Judges 16. 28.

Hanna prayed unto the Lord and wept sore, etc. She spoke in her heart, only
her lips moved, but her voice was not heard, 1 Samuel 1. 10, 11, 12, 13.

As for me, God forbid that I should sin against the Lord in ceasing to pray
for you, 1 Samuel 12. 23.

David prays that it may be with him and his house, as God had said to him by
Nathan the Prophet, 2 Samuel 7. 17, 18, 19, to the 29.

While the child was alive, I fasted, and I said, Who can tell whether God will
be gracious? 2 Samuel 12. 22. Jonah 3. 8, 9.

God said to Solomon, ask what I shall give thee. And Solomon asked wisdom to
govern; and God was pleased so with that, and in that he had not asked long
life and riches; that God gave him wisdom, and understanding, and riches, and
honor also, 1 Kings 3. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13.

King Solomon prayed at large, at the dedication of the Temple, and God heard
him, 1 Kings 8. 22, 23, 24, etc. chapter 9. 2, 3. 2 Chronicles. 1. 7, 8, etc.

Elijah the Prophet prayed that it might be made known, that God was God in
Israel, when others were for Baal. And God he heard him, and caused fire to
come down, and consume the sacrifice, 1 Kings 18. 36, 37, 38.

Seek the Lord and his strength, seek his face continually, 1 Chronicles. 16. 11.

If thou seek him, he will be found of thee, 1 Chronicles. 28. 9.

Judah, etc. fought him with their whole desire, and he was found of them, 2 Chronicles. 15. 15.

There are good things found in thee, thou have taken away, etc. and have
prepared thine heart to seek God, 2 Chronicles. 19. 3.

Asa prayed for help against the Ethiopian Army of 1000000, and prevailed, 2 Chronicles. 14. 10, 11, 12.

When Moab, etc. came against Jehosaphat, he stood in the congregation in the
house of the Lord, and prayed for help, and God heard and answered, 2 Chronicles.
20. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 15, 24.

Hezekiah being sick, prayed, 2 Chronicles. 32. 24.

Nehemiah when he heard of the affliction of the Jews, he wept, and mourned,
and fasted, and prayed, Nehem. 1. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, etc.

So again, when Israel were building, and in danger of enemies, Nehem. 4. 4, 5,
9.

I would make supplication to my judge, Job 9. 15.

My God: for unto thee will I pray, my voice shall thou hear in the morning: O
Lord, in the morning will I direct unto thee, and look up, Psalm. 5. 2, 3.

I acknowledged my sin, etc. for this shall every one who is godly pray unto
thee, in a time when thou may be found, Psalm. 32. 5, 6.

They who seek the Lord, shall not lack any good thing, Psalm. 34. 10.

Call upon me in the time of trouble; I will deliver thee, etc. Psalm. 50. 15.

Though Nathan had told David his sin was forgiven him, yet he prays earnestly
to be delivered from blood-guiltiness, etc. Psalm. 51. 1, 2, 3, 4, to the 15.

As for me, I will call upon God: and the Lord shall save me: evening and
morning, at noon will I pray and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice, Psalm.
55. 16, 17.

O thou who ^rest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come, Psalm. 65. 2.

If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me. But verily God
has heard, Psalm. 66. 18, 19.

Thou Lord art good and ready to forgive: and plenteous in mercy unto all them
who call upon thee. Give ear, O Lord, unto my Prayer, etc. In the day of my
trouble I will call upon thee: for thou will answer me, Psalm. 86. 5, 6, 7.

He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayers,
Psalm. 102. 17.

I cried with my whole heart, etc. I prevented the dawning of the morning, and
cried, Psalm. 119. 145, 147.

In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and he heard me, Psalm. 120. 1. 2 Samuel
22. 7.

Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper who love thee, Psalm. 122.
6.

The Lord is nigh unto all who call upon him: to all who call upon him in
truth; he will fulfill the desire of them who fear him: he also will hear their
cry, and will save them, Psalm. 145. 18, 19.

The sacrifice of the wicked, is an abomination to the Lord: but the prayer of
the upright is his delight, etc. He hears the prayer of the righteous, Prove.
15. 8, 29.

He who turns away his ear from hearing the Law, even his prayer shall be an
abomination, Prove. 28. 9.

Be not rash with thy mouth, and be not hasty to utter any thing before God:
for God is in heaven, and thou upon earth; therefore let thy words be few,
Eccles. 5. 2.

When ye spread forth your hands, I will hide my eyes from you: yea, when ye
make many prayers (or multiply Prayers) I will not hear: your hands are full of
blood, wash ye, etc. Isa. 1. 15, 16.

In trouble have they visited thee: they poured out a prayer (or secret speech)
when thy chastening was upon them, Isa. 26. 16.

Thou have not called upon me, O Jacob, Isa. 43. 21.

Thus says the Lord, etc. ask me of things to come: concerning my sons, and
concerning the works of my hands, command ye me, etc. I said not unto the seed
of Jacob, seek ye me in vain, Isa. 45. 11, 19.

Seek ye the Lord while he may be found, call ye upon him while he is near,
Isa. 55. 6.

When thou cryest, let thy companions deliver thee, Isa. 57. 13.

For Zions sake will I not hold my peace; and for Jerusalems sake I will not
rest until the righteousness thereof goes forth, etc. I have set watchmen upon

thereof, celebrate his praises, extol him, and stir up others so to do.

who has not left destitute my Master, of his mercy and his truth, etc. When he
heard their words, he worshipped the Lord, etc. Genesis 24. 26, 27, 52.

Can any hide himself in secret praces, that I shall not see him, says the
Lord? Do not I fill heaven and earth, etc? Jer. 23. 24.

The great, the mighty God, the Lord of Hosts is his name: great in counsel,
and mighty in work, etc. I will give them one heart, and one way, that they may
fear me for ever, etc. I will put my fear into their hearts. Jer. 32. 18, 19,
39, 40.

The Lord shall utter his voice before his army, etc. for the day of the Lord
is great, and very terrible, and who can abide it? Joel 2. 11.

God is jealous, the Lord revengeth, etc. He rebukes the Sea, and makes it
dry, etc. The mountains quake at him, and the hills melt, etc. Nahum. 1. 2, 3,
4, 5, 6.

If I be a master, Where is my fear, etc? I am a great King, says the Lord of
Hosts; and my name is dreadful amongst the heathen, Mal. 1. 6, 14.

I will be a swift witness against the sorcerer, etc. And fear not me, says
the Lord of Hosts, etc. A book of remembrance was written before him, for them
who feared the Lord, and that thought of his name. And they shall be mine,
says the Lord, Mal. 3. 5, 16, 17.

But unto you, who fear my name, shall the Sun of righteousness arise with
healing in his wings, and ye shall grow, etc. Mal. 4. 2.

Fear him, who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell, Mat. 10. 28.

His mercy is on them who fear him, from generation to generation; he has
showed strength, etc. He has put down the mighty, etc. Luke 1. 50, 51, 52, 53.

The most High, dwells not in temples made with hands, etc. Heaven is my
throne, etc. Has not my hand made all these things? Acts 7. 48, 49, 50.

The Churches were edified, and walked in the fear of the Lord, Acts 9. 31.

In every nation, he who fears him, etc. is accepted with him, Acts 10. 35.

God, who made the world, and all things therein, seeing he is God, etc. Acts
17. 24, 25, etc.

All things are naked and open unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do,
Heb. 4. 13.

It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God, Heb. 10. 31.

Let us have grace whereby we may serve God acceptably, with reverence and
godly fear. For our God is a consuming fire, Heb. 12. 28, 29.

Pass the time of your sojourning here in fear, 1 Pet. 1. 17. 2 Cor. 7. 1.

Fear God, 1 Pet. 2. 17.

Fear God, and give glory to him, for the hour of his Judgment is come, Rev.
14. 7.

Great and mavelous are thy works, Lord God Almighty, etc. Who shall not fear
thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name? for thou only art holy, Rev. 15. 3, 4.

To trust in God, and in none else, in all Cases: The Arguments thereto.
1. Not in any else.
There is none besides thee, neither is there any rock like unto God, 1 Samuel 2.
2.

Because thou have relied on the King of Assyria, and not relied on the Lord
thy God; therefore is the host of the King of Syria escaped out of thy hands,
etc. Asa in his disease fought not to the Lord, but to the Physicians. 2 Chronicles.
16. 7. 12.

There is no King saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not
delivered by much strength. A horse is a vain thing for safety; neither shall
he deliver by his great strength, Psalm. 33. 16. 17.

They who trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their
riches: None can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for
him, etc. that he should live for ever, Psalm. 49. 6, 7, 9.

Lo, this is the man who made not God his strength; but trusted in the
abundance of his riches, etc. But I trust in the mercy of God for ever, Psalm.
52. 7, 8.

Give us help from trouble, for vain is the help of man, Psalm. 60. 11.

Surely, men of low degree are vanity, men of high degree a lie; to be laid in
the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity. Trust not in oppression,
etc. Psalm. 62. 9, 10.

Put not your trust in Princes, nor in the sons of men, in whom is no help; his
breath goes sorth, he turns to his earth: in that very day his thoughts
perish, Psalm. 146. 3, 4.

He who trusted unto his riches, shall fall, Prove. 11. 28.

He who trusts in his own heart, is a fool, Prove. 28. 26.

Cease from man whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be
accounted of? Isa. 2. 22.

Thou did look in that day unto the armor of the house of the forest, etc.
ye made also a ditch between the two walls, etc. But ye have not looked unto
the maker thereof, Isa. 22. 8, 9, 10, 11.

Woe unto the rebellious children, etc. who take counsel, but not of me, etc.
who walk to go down to Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth, to strengthen
themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt:
Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the
shadow of Egypt confusion, etc. for the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no
purpose, etc. their strength is to sit still, Isa. 30. 1, 2, 3, 5, 7.

Thou have trusted in thy wickedness: thou have said, None sees, etc. Thou
have said in thine heart, I am, and none else besides me, etc. Stand now with
thine enchantments, etc. let them stand up and save thee, etc. Behold, they
shall be as stubble, etc. None shall save thee, Isa. 47. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15.

Truly, in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitudes
of mountains, etc. Jer. 3. 23.

Trust ye not in lying words, Saying the Temple of the Lord, etc. Jer. 7. 4.

Trust ye not in any brother, for every brother will utterly supplant, Jer. 9.
4, 5.

This is thy portion, etc. because thou have forgotten me, and trusted in
falsehood: Therefore will I discover thy skirts upon thy face, etc. Jer. 13. 25,
26.

Thus says the Lord, Cursed be the man who trusts in man, and makes flesh
his arm, and whose heart departs from God; for he shall be like the heath in
the desert, etc. Jer. 17. 5, 6.

For because thou have trusted in thy works, and in thy treasures, thou shall
also be taken, etc. Jer. 48. 7.

Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, etc. O backsliding daughter, who
trusts in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me? Behold, I will bring
fear upon thee, says the Lord of Host, Jer. 49. 4, 5.

As for us, our eyes as yet failed for our vain hope in our watching: we have
wtached for a nation which could not save us, Lam. 4. 17.

Egypt shall know, etc. because they have been a staff of reed to the house of
Israel, when they took hold of thee by thy hand, thou did break and rent all
their shoulders; and when they leaned upon thee, thou brakest all their loins,
etc. Ezekiel. 29. 6, 7.

They shall know that I am the Lord, when I have set a fire in Egypt, and when
all her helpers shall be destroyed, Ezekiel. 30. 8.

Ephraim also is like a silly Dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go
to Assyria; when they shall go, I will spread my net upon them, I will bring
them down, etc. Woe unto them, for they have fled from me, Hosea 7. 11, 12, 13.

Ephraim feeds upon wind, etc. they do make a covenant with the Assyrians,
etc. Hosea 12. 1.

Woe unto them who are at ease in Zion, and trust in the mountains of Samaria,
Amos 6. 1.

Trust ye not in a friend, put ye not confidence in a guide; keep the door of
thy mouth from her who lies in thy bosom. For the son dishonors the father,
etc. Micah 7. 5, 6.

We had the sentence of death in our selves, that we should not trust in our
selves, 1 Cor. 1. 9.

2. In God alone, a suitable Object.
God said, Let there be light, and there was light, etc. Genesis 1. 3, 6, 9, etc.

When Sarah doubted of the promise, because of her age: The Lord said to
Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of surety bear a child,
which am old? Is any thing too hard for the Lord? Genesis 18. 12, 13, 14. Luke 1.
37.

When Hagar was fainting, and thought there was no way but death with her
child, God showed her a well of water, etc. Genesis 21. 15, 16, 17, 18, 19.

When Joseph's brethren had conspired to kill him, God works for his
deliverance, Genesis 37. 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, etc.

When God was sending Moses upon a great work; Moses said unto the Lord, O my
Lord, I am not eloquent, etc. but I am slow of speech, etc. And the Lord said
unto him, Who has made man's mouth? or who makes the dumb, or the deaf, or the
seeing, or the blind? Have not I the Lord? Now therefore go, and I will be with
thy mouth, etc. Exodus 4. 10, 11, 12.

And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still and see the salvation
of the Lord; which he will show to you to day, etc. the Lord shall fight for
you, etc. And the Angel of God which went before the Camp, removed, and went
behind them, etc. between the Camp of the Egyptians, and the Camp of Israel,
etc. Led them through the Red Sea, Exodus 14. 13, 14, 19, 20, 21, 22.

The Lord shall reign for ever and ever, Exodus 15. 18.

The Lord, etc. proclaimed the name of the Lord: The Lord, the Lord God
merciful and gracious, long-suffering and abundant in goodness and truth;
keeping mercy for thousands: forgiving iniquity, transgression and sin, etc.
Exodus 34. 5, 6, 7.

And Moses said, The people amongst whom I am, are 600000, etc. shall the
flocks and the herds be slain for them, to suffice them? or shall all the fish
of the Sea be gathered together for them? etc. And the Lord said unto Moses, Is
the Lords hand waxed short? thou shall see, etc. Numb. 11. 21, 22, 23.

God is not a man that he should lie, neither the Son of man that he should
repent: Has he said, and shall he not do? or has he spoken, and shall he not
make it good? Behold, etc. He has blessed, and I cannot reverse it, Heb. 6.
18. Numb. 23. 19, 20. Tit. 1. 2.

What God is there in heaven or earth, that can do according to thy works, and
according to thy might, Deuteronomy. 3. 24.

Unto thee it was showed, that thou might know, that the Lord he is God:
there is none else besides him, etc. Deuteronomy. 4. 35, 39.

Know therefore, that the Lord thy God, he is God, the faithful God; who
keeps covenant and mercy with them who love him, etc. Deuteronomy. 7. 9.

Understand therefore this day, that the Lord thy God, he who goes before thee
as a consuming fire, he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before
thy face: so shall thou drive them out, etc. Deuteronomy. 9. 3.

There shall be no man able to stand before you, for the Lord your God shall
lay the fear of you, etc. Deuteronomy. 11. 25. Joshua 5. 1. 2 Chronicles. 14. 14. Chap. 17.
10.

Their rock is not as our rock, the enemies themselves being judges, etc See
now that I, I am he, and there is no God with me: I kill, and I make alive; I
wound, and I heal; neither is there any who can deliver out of my hand: for I
lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever, Deuteronomy 32. 31, 39, 40.

There is none like unto the God of Jesurun, who rides upon the heaven for thy
help, and in his Excellency on the sky: The eternal God thy refuge, and
underneath are the everlasting arms; and he shall thrust out the enemy from
before thee, etc. Deuteronomy. 33. 26, 27.

Hereby ye shall know, that the living God is among you, etc. Joshua 3. 10.

Not one thing has failed of all the good things which the Lord your God spoke
concerning you: all are come to pass unto you, and not one thing has failed
thereof, etc. Joshua 23. 14.

There is none besides thee; neither is there any rock like our God, etc. The
Lord kills and makes alive; he brings down to the grave, and brings up:
The Lord makes poor, and makes rich; he brings low, and lifts up: he
raises up the poor out of the dust, lifts up the beggar from the dunghill, to
set among Princes; and make them to inherit the throne of glory: for the
pillars of the earth are the Lords, and he has set the world upon them, 1 Samuel
2. 2, 6, 7, 8. Luke 1. 51, 52, 53.

It may be the Lord will work for us; for there is no restraint to the Lord to
save by many or by few, 1 Samuel 14. 6.

Then said David to the Philistine, Thou come to me with a sword and with a
spear, and with a shield: but I come unto thee in the name of the Lord of Host,
the God of the armies of Israel, etc. I will smite thee, etc. that all the
earth may know there is a God in Israel, 1 Samuel 17. 45, 46.

And David was greatly distressed; for the people spoke of stoning him, etc.
but David encouraged himself in the Lord his God, 1 Samuel 30. 6.

The Lord is my rock, etc. the God of my rock; in him will I trust, etc. He is
a buckler to all them that trust in him: For who is God save the Lord? and who
a rock save our God? 2 Samuel 22. 2, 3, 31, 32.

Alas my master, how shall we do? And he answered, Fear not, for they with us
are more than they with them. And Elisha prayed, etc. 2 Kings 6. 16.

The children of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon the Lord God of
their fathers, 2 Chronicles. 13. 18.

Hezekiah said unto the people (when the king of Assyria came against him), Be
strong and courageous; be not afraid or dismayed for the the king of Assyria,
nor for all the multitude that is with him; for there are more with us than
with them; with him an arm of flesh; but with us, the Lord our God, to help us,
and to fight our battles, 2 Chronicles. 32. 6, 7, 8.

The Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus to make proclamation for the building
of Jerusalem, the Temple, and restoring the vessels of the house of the Lord,

Can thou by searching find out God? etc. If he cut off, and shut up, and

Job reckons up many works of God, and concludes thus: Lo these parts of his

I know that thou can do every thing, and no thought can be withholden from

He heals the broken in heart, and binds up their wounds: he tells the

Trust in the Lord with all thine heart, and lean not to thine own

There is no wisdom or understanding, nor counsel against the Lord. The horse

Whosoever puts his trust in the Lord, shall be safe: Many seek the rulers

There shall be desolation, because thou have forgotten the God of thy

Thou have been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his

and avoid boasting of our selves: the Reasons.

dust and ashes, Genesis 18. 27.

16. 1, 2, 3, 12, 21, 31, 32.
