continuance of afflictions and persecutions, and that according to our need
God said unto Abraham, Know assuredly, that thy feed shall be a stranger in a
land that is not theirs, and shall serve them, and they shall afflict them four
hundred years, etc. But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again,
Genesis 15. 13, 14, 15, 16.

And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years, the self-same
day it came to pass, that all the host of the Lord went out of the land of
Egypt, Exodus 12. 40, 41, 51.

God led Israel through the wilderness, that they should not see war and be
discouraged, Exodus 13. 17.

Their heart was not right with him, etc. but he being full of compassion,
forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not; yea, many a time turned he his
anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath. For he remembered that they were
but flesh; a wind which passes away, and comes not again, Psalm. 78. 37, 38,
39.

I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness
have afflicted me, Psalm. 119. 75.

It shall come to pass, when the Lord has performed his whole work upon mount
Sion, and upon Jerusalem; I will punish the fruit of the stout-heart, etc. O my
people, be not afraid of the Assyrian, he shall smite thee with a rod, etc. For
yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, etc. Isa. 10. 12, 24,
25.

In measure, when it shoots forth, thou will debate with it: he stays his
rough wind in the day of his east wind, Isa. 27. 7, 8.

Thus says the Lord, That after seventy years be accomplished at Babylon, I
will visit you, and perform my good toward you, in causing you to return, etc.
Jer. 29. 10. Ezra 1. 1, 2, 3.

I will not make a full end of thee; but I will correct thee in measure, and
will not, etc. Jer. 30. 11. chapter 46. 28.

He does not afflict willingly (or, from his heart) nor grieve the children of
men, Lam. 3. 33.

Against thy holy Child Jesus, etc. To do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel
determined before to be done, Act. 4. 27, 28.

God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that you are
able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be
able to bear, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

He was sick, nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him, etc. but on me also,
left I should have sorrow upon sorrow, Phil. 2. 27.

Ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season (if need be) ye are in heaviness
through manifold temptations, 1 Pet. 1. 6.

The God of all grace, etc. after that ye have suffered a while, make you
perfect, 1 Pet. 5. 10.

Behold, the Devil shall cast some of you into prison, etc. and ye shall have
tribulation ten days. Be thou faithful unto death, and I will give, etc. Rev.
2. 10.

5thly, That God does sometimes make enemies, and the persecutors themselves,
to acknowledge the Saints innocence when they suffer. And will surely avenge
them upon their adversaries.
He will revenge the blood of his servants, and will render vengeance to to his
adversaries: and will be merciful to his land, etc. Deuteronomy. 32. 43.

When David had spared Saul, being in his hands, Saul said to David, Is this
thy voice, my son David, etc? Thou art more righteous than I: for thou have
rewarded me good, whereas I have rewarded thee evil; and thou have showed this
day how thou have done well with me, forasmuch as when the Lord had delivered
me into thine hands, thou killedst me not, etc. 1 Samuel 24. 16, 17, 18, 19.

Again, in the like case, Saul said, I have sinned, etc. Behold, I have played
the fool, and have erred exceedingly, 1 Samuel 26. 21.

Haman, Mordecai's great enemy, forced to honor Mordecai, etc. Esther 6. 7, 8,
9, 10, 11.

Haman is hanged upon the same gallows he erected for Mordecai, Esther 7. 9, 10.

He ordained his arrows against the persecutors, Psalm. 7. 13.

They have dug a pit for me, into the midst of which they are fallen, Psalm.
57. 6.

The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance, etc. so that a man
shall say, etc. Verily he is a God who judges in the earth, Psalm. 58. 10, 11.

The Lord executes righteousness and judgment for all who are oppressed, Psalm.
103. 6.

Be not afraid, etc. for yet a very little while, and the indignation shall
cease, and mine anger in their destruction, Isa. 10. 24, 25.

When thine hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see and be
ashamed for envy at thy people (or, toward thy people), etc. Isaiah 26. 11.

All who watch for iniquity, are cut off: who make a man an offender for a
word, Isa. 29. 20, 21.

I was wrath with my people, etc. thou did show them no mercy, etc. therefore
these two things shall come upon thee in a moment, etc. Isa. 47. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9.

Fear ye not the reproach of men, etc. for the moth shall eat them up like a
garment: and the worm shall eat them like wood, etc. Thus says the Lord, etc.
who pleads the cause of his people: Behold, I have taken out of thy hand the
cup of trembling, the dregs of the cup of my fury, etc. but I will put it into
the hands of them who afflict thee: who have said to thy soul, Bow down, etc.
Isa. 51. 7, 8, 21, 22, 23.

Your brethren who hated you, etc. he shall appear to your joy, and they shall
be ashamed, Isa. 66. 5.

God threatens several nations for their insolent insulting over his people the
Jews, and for their cruel usages of them: and declares the vengeance he would
take against them, Ezekiel. 25. chap. 26. chap. 35. chap. 36.

Nebuchadnezzar, who had caused Shadrach, Meshech and Abednego to be cast into
the fiery-furnace, now said unto them, Ye servants of the most high God, come
forth, etc. and the king promoted them, Dan. 3. 26, 30.

So did Darius, when Daniel by the prosecution of the Presidents and Princes
was cast into the lions den: came and said, O Daniel, servant of the living
God, etc. And the king commanded, and they brought those men who had accused
Daniel, and they cast them into the den of lions, them, their children, and
their wives, etc. Dan. 6. 20, 24.

I have heard the rep^ch of Moab, and the revilings of the children of Ammon,
whereby they have reproached my people, etc. therefore as I live, says the
Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, Surely Moab shall be as Sodom, Zephan. 2. 8,
9, 10, 11.

Whosoever shall offend one of these little ones, who believe in me, it were better
for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were drowned in
the depth of the sea: Woe unto the world because of offenses, Matthew. 18. 6, 7,
10. Luke 17. 1, 2.

I send unto you Prophets, etc. some of them you shall kill, etc. that upon you
may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth from the blood of
righteous Abel, etc. All these things shall come upon this generation, Matthew.
23. 34, 35, 36.

Shall not God avenge his own elect, who cry day and night unto him? though he
bear long with them, I tell you, that he will avenge them speedily, Luke 18. 7,
8.

Pilate himself said of Christ, I find no fault in him, etc. Luke 23. 14.

King Agrippa and Festus both said of Paul, This man does nothing worthy of
death, or of bonds, Acts 26. 30, 31.

In nothing terrified by your adversaries, which is to them an evident token of
perdition, etc. and that of God, Phil. 1. 28.

It is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them who trouble
you, etc. 2 Thessalonians. 1. 6.

He who leads into captivity, shall go into captivity: he who kills with
the sword, must be killed, etc. Here is the patience and the faith of the
Saints, Rev. 13. 10.

Babylon is fallen: here is the patience of the Saints, Revel. 14, 8, 9, 10,
11, 12.

Thou art righteous, O Lord, etc. because thou have judged thus: for they have
shed the blood of Saints and Prophets, and thou have given them blood to drink;
for they are worthy, Rev. 16. 5, 6.

6thly, That God will comfort, uphold, and preserve his in all their troubles:
and not lay more on them than they can bear.
In that he himself has suffered, being tempted, he is able to succor them
who are tempted, Heb. 2. 18. chap. 4. 15. chap. 5. 2.

And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not
through the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near: for God
said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they fee war, and they return to
Egypt, etc. And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud to lead
them the way: and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light to go by day
and night, Exodus 13. 17, 21.

Thou shall not be afraid, etc. for the Lord thy God is among you, a mighty God
and terrible: and the Lord thy God will put out those nations before thee by
little and little, Deuteronomy. 7. 19, 20, 21, 22.

The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms: and he
shall thrust out the enemy from before thee, Deuteronomy. 33. 27.

David was greatly distressed, etc. but David encouraged himself in the Lord, 1 Samuel 30. 6.

Will he plead against me with his great power? no, but he would put strength
into me, Joh 23. 6.

The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in time of trouble:
thou will save the afflicted people, Psalm. 9. 9. Psalm. 18. 27.

Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil:
for thou art with me: thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me: thou preparest a
table for me in the sight of mine enemies, etc. Psalm. 23. 4, 5.

In the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion, in the secret of his
tabernacle shall he hide me: he shall set me upon a rock, etc. when my father
and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me up, etc. Wait on the Lord,
etc. he shall strengthen thine heart, Psalm. 27. 5, 10, 14.

Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them who fear him, etc. to deliver their
soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine, Psalm. 33. 18, 19.

The wicked watches the righteous, and seeks to slay him; the Lord will not
leave him in his hand, etc. the Lord, he is their strength in time of trouble:
and the Lord shall help them, and deliver them, etc. Psalm. 37. 32, 33, 39, 40.

Therefore will we not fear, though the earth be moved, etc. There is a river,
the streams whereof shall make glad the City of God, etc. God is in the midst
of her, she shall not be moved: God shall help her right early, Psalm. 46. 1, 2,
3, 4, 5.

Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never
suffer the righteous to be removed, Psalm. 55. 22.

Bless our God, etc. who holds our soul in life, and suffers not our feet
to be moved: for thou, O Lord, have proved us, thou have tried us as silver is
tried; thou broughtest us into the net, thou laidst afflictions upon our loins:
thou have caused men to ride over our heads, etc. Psalm. 66. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12.

But he, full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not:
yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath:
for he remembered they were but flesh, a wind which passes away, and comes not
again, Psalm. 78. 38, 39.

He preserves the soul of his Saints: he delivers them out of the hand of
the wicked, Psalm. 97. 10.

Like as a father pitieth his children, so the Lord pitieth them who fear him:
for he knows our frame, he remembers we are but dust, Psalm. 103. 13, 14.

If it had not been the Lord, who was on our side, now may Israel say, etc.
when men rose up against us, then they had swallowed us up quick, etc. then the
waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul: then the proud
waters had gone over our soul, Psalm. 114. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8.

Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou will revive me: thou shall stretch
forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, Psalm. 138. 7.

The Lord will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish, Prove. 10. 3.

Thou have been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his
distress: a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat; when the blast of
the terrible one is as a storm against the wall, Isa. 25. 4.

He stays his rough wind in the day of the east wind, Isa. 27. 8.

A king shall reign, etc. and a man shall be a hiding place from the wind, and
a covert from the tempest: as rivers of water in a dry place; as the shadow of
a great rock in a weary land, Isa. 32. 1, 2.

When the poor and needy seek water and there is none, and their tongue fails
for thirst: I the Lord will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake
them: I will open rivers in high places, etc. I will make the wilderness a pool
of water, and the dry land springs of water, Isa. 41. 17, 18, 19.

When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee, and through the
rivers they shall not overflow thee: when thou walk through the fire thou
shall not be burned, neither shall the flame kindle upon thee: for I am the
Lord thy God, Isa. 43. 2, 3.

The Lord has comforted his people, and will have mercy on his afflicted, Isa.
49. 13.

Thus says the high and lofty one, etc. I dwell, etc. with him also who is of
a contrite spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart
of the contrite ones: for I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always
wrath: for the spirit should fail before me, and the Souls I have made, Isa.
57. 15, 16.

When the enemy shall come in like a flood, the spirit of the Lord shall lift
up a standard against him, Isa. 59. 19.

Your brethren who hate you, that cast you out for my names sake, said, Let the
Lord be glorified: but he shall appear unto your joy, etc. Isa. 66. 5.

Although I have cast them off among the heathen, etc. yet will I be unto them
as a little sanctuary in the countries where they shall come, Ezekiel. 11. 16.

God preserved his in the fiery furnace, and Daniel in the Lions den, Dan. 3.
25. Dan. 6. 22.

How shall I give thee up? Ephraim, etc! mine heart is turned within me, my
repentings are kindled together: I will not execute the fierceness of mine
anger: for I am God, and not man, etc. Hosea 11. 8, 9.

Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise: when I sit
in darkness, the Lord shall be a light to me, Micah. 7. 8.

The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble, and he knows them,
etc. Nahum 1. 7.

When they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it
shall be given you in that same hour, what ye shall speak, Matthew. 10. 19.

God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that you are
able: but will with the temptations also make a way to escape, that ye may be
able to bear it, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

Blessed be God, etc. the God of all comfort, who comfort us in all our
tribulations, etc. For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our
consolations also abounds by Christ, 2 Cor. 1. 3, 4, 5.

We are troubled on every side, etc. persecuted, but not forsaken, etc. always
bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus; that the life also of
Jesus might be manifest in our body, etc. the inward man is renewed, etc. 2
Cor. 4. 8, 9, 10, 16.

We had trouble on every side, etc. Nevertheless God who comfort them who
are cast down, comforted us, etc. 2 Cor. 7. 5, 6.

I besought the Lord thrice, etc. and he said unto me, My grace is sufficient
for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness, 2 Cor. 12. 8, 9, 10.

At my first answer no man stood with me, etc. Notwithstanding the Lord stood
with me, and strengthened me, etc. And the Lord shall deliver me, etc. 2 Timothy
4. 16, 17, 18.

Every where, and in all things I am instructed, both to be full and to be
hungry, etc. I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me, Phil. 4.
11, 12, 13.

See the Saints privileges in common calamities, Chap. 23.

7thly, That the Saints are near and dear to God in Christ, so that he takes
special notice of their afflictions and troubles, and is said to be persecuted
and afflicted in their persecutions and afflictions.
And the Lord said, Surely I have seen the affliction of my people who are in
Egypt, and have heard their cry, by reason of their task masters: for I know
their sorrows, and I am come down to deliver them, etc. Exodus 3. 7, 8, 9.

The Lords portion is his people, Jacob is the lot of his inheritance: he found
him in a desert land, etc. He led him about (or, encompassed him about): he
kept, he instructed him as the apple of his eye, etc. Deuteronomy. 32. 9, 10.

For the Lord saw the affliction of Israel that it was very bitter, 2 Kings 14.
26.

Thou have considered my trouble, thou have known my soul in adversity, Psalm.
31. 7.

Thou have known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor: mine adversaries
are all before thee, Psalm. 69. 19.

The Lord will not cast off his people: neither will he forsake his
inheritance, Psalm. 94. 14.

He reproved kings for their sakes, saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my
prophets no harm, Psalm. 105. 14, 15.

They provoked him, etc. nevertheless he regarded their afflictions when he
heard their cry: and he remembered for them his covenant: and repented according
to the multitude of his mercies, Psalm. 106. 43, 44, 45, 46.

I was wroth with my people, etc. and given them into thine hand: thou did
show them no mercy: upon the ancient have thou very heavily laid the yoke, Isa.
47. 6.

Zion said, The Lord has forsaken me, and my Lord has forgotten me. Can a
woman forget her sucking-child, that she should not have compassion on the son
of her womb? Yea, they may forget, yet will I not forget thee: Behold, I have
graven thee upon the palms of my hand: thy walls are continually before me,
Isa. 49. 14, 15, 16.

Fear not, for thou shall not be ashamed, etc. for thy maker is thine husband,
the Lord of hosts is his name: and thy redeemer the holy one of Israel, Isa.
54. 4, 5.

For he said, Surely they are my people, children who will not lie: so he was
their Savior: in all their afflictions he was afflicted, and the Angel of his
presence saved them: and in his love, and in his pity, he redeemed them, etc.
Isa. 63. 8, 9.

Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a pleasant child? for since I spoke against him,
I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my bowels are troubled for him: I
will surely have mercy on him, says the Lord, Jer. 31. 20.

I see four men walking in the fire, and they have no hurt: and the form of the
fourth is like the Son of God, Dan. 3. 25.

How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? how shall I deliver thee, Israel, etc? mine
heart is turned within me, my repentings are kindled, Hosea 11. 8.

The Lord is good, a strong hold (or, strength) in the day of trouble, and he
knows them who trusts in him, Nahum 1. 7.

I am sore displeased, etc. for I was but a little displeased, and they helped
forward the affliction, Zech. 1. 15.

He sent me unto the nations which spoiled you: for he who touches you,
touches the apple of his eye. For behold, I will shake mine hand upon them,
and they shall be a spoil, etc. Zech. 2. 8.

The very hairs of your head are all numbered, etc. He who receives you,
receives me, etc. Matthew. 10. 30, 40, 42.

Then shall the king say unto them on his right hand, etc. I was an hungry, and
ye gave me meat, etc. Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, When saw we
thee an hungered, etc? and the king shall answer and say unto them, Verily, I
say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my
brethren, ye have done it unto me. Then shall he say also unto them on the left
hand, depart from me ye cursed, etc. For I was an hungry, and ye gave me no
meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me
not in: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me
not. Then shall they answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungry? then
shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, inasmuch, as ye did it not
to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me, Matt. 25. 34, 35, 36, 37,
40, 41, 42, 43, 44, 45.

And Saul yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the Disciples of
the Lord, etc. he heard a voice, saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest
thou me? and he said, Who art thou Lord? and the Lord said, I am Jesus whom
thou persecutest, it is hard for thee to kick, etc. Act. 9. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. chapter
16. 14, 15.

We are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones, Ephesians. 5. 30.

We have not an High Priest, who cannot be touched with the feeling of our
infirmities: but was in all points tempted like as we are: yet without sin,
Heb. 4. 15. chapter 2. 18. chapter 5. 2.

See Union and Relation between Christ and his Church, Chap. 15.

8thly, That the greater the afflictions and distresses of the Saints have
been, the more wonderful have their deliverances been: and then has Salvation
been nearest, when Extremity was highest, and Danger greatest.
When Lot was taken Prisoner and carried away, and all his goods, God by
Abraham wonderfully recovered all, and brought him back again, Genesis 14. 11, 12,
13, 14, 15, 16.

Hagar is in such distress for her child, for want of water, that she lays it
down and leaves it, that she might not see it dye, and sets far off weeping;
then God speaks to her by the Angel: and God opened her eyes, and she saw a
well of water, etc. Genesis 21. 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20.

When the Egyptians oppressed most, and made Isreal's burdens heaviest,
insomuch that they despaired, then God came and made known himself, and said to
Moses, Now shall thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for with a strong hand
shall he let them go, etc. I have also heard the groanings of the children of
Israel, etc. I will bring ye out from under the burden of the Egyptians, and I
will rid you out of their bondage; and I will redeem you with a stretched-out
arm, and with great judgment, etc. Exodus 5. chap. 6. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

And God did so deliver them, after he had showed many wonders upon the
Egyptians, and smote their firstborn, Exodus 12. 29, 30, 31, 32, etc.

And the Lord went before them by day, in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the
way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, etc. Exodus 13. 21.

When Pharaoh and his host pursued Israel, so that they reckoned themselves
lost, and were in great distress, then the Angel of God which went before the
Camp, removed and went behind them, etc. between the Camp of the Egyptians and
them: and the Lord divided the sea, while Israel passed through, and there
drowned all the Egyptians, Exodus 14. 10, 11, 12, 16, 17, 18, etc.

The Lord shall judge his people, and repent himself for his servants, when he
sees that their power is gone, and there is none shut up or left, Deuteronomy. 32. 36.

When David was great in distress, because Ziklag was burned, his wives, and
the wives of his followers taken away, and all their substance, by the
Amalekites, and his men spoke of killing him; then God directs him to pursue
the Amalekites, and he recovered all again by a wonderful hand, 1 Samuel 30. 1,
2, 3, to the 20.

When king David was in great danger at hand, by the counsel of Ahitophel in
the time of Absoloms rebellion; God overthrew the counsel, by the counsel of
Hushai, and so marvellously preserved David, 2 Samuel 17. 1, 2, 3, etc.

When Elijah fled from Ahab in a time of famine, God commanded the Ravens to
feed him, etc. and the Ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morn, etc.
when the brook dried up, God sent him to a widow to nourish him; when her meal
was out, God caused the barrel of meal not to waste, the cruse of oil not to
fail until the Lord sent rain, 1 King. 17. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, to the 17.

So again, when he fled from Jezebel, and had requested of God that he might
dye, the angel comes to him, and gives him bread and water twice, and then
enabled him to go in the strength thereof many days, 1 Kings 19. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,
6, 7, 8.

When the wife of one of the sons of the Prophets was in distress, because of
poverty, and danger of creditors, God by Elisha makes her pot of oil to
increase, to the filling of many vessels, to pay her debts with, 2 Kings 4. 1,
2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

When Samaria was besieged, and in great distress by reason of the sad famine
in it, God on a sudden makes the Assyrians fly and leave plenty behind them in
their camp, and so relieved his people, 2 Kings 6. chap. 7.

When Judah was environed, the battle before and behind them, then God
delivered them, and overcame their enemies, slew five hundred thousand of them,
2 Chronicles. 13. 14, 15, 16, 17, 18.

When the Jews were by Hamans procurement appointed to slaughter, and the
decree just ready to be executed, and they greatly distressed and helpless:
Then God appeared, and delivered in a mavelous manner, Esther 3. chap. 6.
chap. 7.

Thou have enlarged me when I was in distress, Psalm. 4. 1.

When the Psalmist had reckoned up the sad state Gods people had been reduced
to, he says, Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, like a mighty man, etc.
and he smote his enemies in the hinder part: he put them to a perpetual
reproach, Psalm. 78. 61, 62, 63, 64, 65, 66.

Thou turnest man to destruction: and say, Return ye children of men, Ps. 90.
1.

God slew the Assyrians, and saved Judah when they were low, Isa. 36. chapter 37.

I will heal thee, etc. because they call thee an outcast, saying, This is
Zion whom no man looks after: Thus says the Lord, behold, I will bring again
the captivity of Jacobs tents, Jer. 30. 17, 18.

God appeared for his, when in the fire, and in the lions den, and delivered
them, Dan. 3. chap. 6.

When Peter through unbelief was sinking in the sea, Christ stretched out his
hand, and caught him, and saved him, Matt. 14. 28, 29, 30, 31.

When the Apostles were put into the prison, the Angel of the Lord brought them
out, Act. 5. 18, 19.

Peter being imprisoned, in order to his being brought out to the people, and
being fettered, and lying between two soldiers; the angel of the Lord came,
said, Arise: the chains fell off, the gates open of their own accord, he is
delivered, Act. 12. 1, 2, 3, 4, to the 12.

When Paul and Silas was thrust into the inner prison, and their feet fast in
the stocks, God made the foundation of the prison to shake, and doors fly open,
and delivered Paul and Silas, Act. 16. 23, 24, 26, 29, 30, 39.

Paul, when the Jews went about to kill him, was delivered by the captain, etc.
Act. 21. 30, 31, 32.

Paul and his company strangely saved in their voyage by sea, and shipwreck,
Act. 27.

9thly, That Afflictions and Persecutions, shall be for the great good of
Saints.
It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go unto the house of
feasting: for that is the end of all men, and the living will lay it to his
heart. Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance,
the heart is made better, Eccles. 7. 2, 3.

By this shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged: and this is all the fruit, to
take away his sin, Isa. 27. 9.

I will bring the third part through the fire, etc. they shall call on my name,
and I will hear them. I will say, it is my people, and they shall say, the Lord
is my God, Zech. 13. 9.

Blessed are ye, when men shall revile you and persecute you, etc. rejoice and
be exceeding glad, for great is your reward in heaven, Matt. 5. 11, 12.

Whosoever will lose his life for my sake, shall find it, Matt. 16. 25. Joh.
12. 25.

Every one who has forsaken houses, etc. for my name sake, shall receive an
hundred fold, and shall inherit everlasting life, Matt. 19. 29. Luke 18. 29, 30.

Blessed are ye who hunger now, for ye shall be filled: blessed are ye who weep
now, for ye shall laugh, Luke 6. 21.

In nothing terrified, etc. which is to them an evident token of, etc. but to
you of salvation, and that of God, Phil. 1. 28.

It is a righteous thing with God, to recompense tribulation unto them who
trouble you: and to you who are troubled, rest with us, when the Lord, etc. 2
These. 1. 5, 6, 7.

Ye took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in your selves, that ye
have in heaven a better and an, etc. Heb. 10. 34.

Moses, etc. choosing rather affliction with the people of God, etc. esteeming
the reproach of Christ greater riches, etc. for he had respect unto the
recompense of reward, Heb. 11. 24, 25, 26.

Now no chastening for the present, etc. nevertheless, afterward it yields
the peaceable fruits of righteousness, Heb. 12. 11.

The trial of your faith works patience, etc. blessed is the man who endures
temptations, for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, James 1.
3, 12.

We have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord, James
5. 11.

Rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings, that when his
glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy, 1 Pet. 4. 13.

These are they who came out of great tribulations, etc. therefore are they
before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple: and he who
sits on the throne, shall dwell among them, etc. shall feed them, etc. and
God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes, Rev. 7. 13, 14, 15, 16, 17.

See some of the ends of Gods afflicting his, Chap. 22.

10thly, That God will not always chide, nor suffer his to be under afflictions
and persecutions; they shall have an end, he will bring deliverance, and
restore joy.
After Israel had been long and sorely oppressed, and afflicted by the
Egyptians, the Lord sent Moses for their deliverance: and said, I have surely
seen the afflictions of my people which are in Egypt, and have heard their cry
by reason of their taskmasters, etc. and I am come-down to deliver them out of
their hand, etc. and to bring them up out of that land, unto a good land, Exodus
3. 7, 8, 9, 10. chap. 6. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.

Yet for all that, when they be in the land of their enemies, I will not cast
them away, neither will I abhor them to destroy them utterly, etc. but I will
for their sakes remember the covenant, etc. I am the Lord, Levit. 26. 43, 44,
45.

For the Lord will judge his people, and repent him for his servants, when he
sees that their power is gone, etc. he will be merciful to his land, etc. Deuteronomy.
32. 36, 43.

He makes sore, and binds up: he wounds, and his hands make whole, Job 5.
18.

And the Lord turned the captivity of Job, etc. also the Lord gave Job twice as
much as he had before, Job 42. 10.

The needy shall not always be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not
perish for ever, Psalm. 9. 18.

Lord, thou have heard the desire of the humble, etc. to judge the fatherless
and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress (or,
terrify), Psalm. 10. 17, 18.

For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I
arise, says the Lord, I will set him in safety from him who would ensnare him,
(or, puffs at them), Psalm. 12. 5.

Sing unto the Lord, O ye Saints of his, etc. for his anger endures but a
moment, etc. weeping may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning,
Psalm. 30. 4, 5.

The righteous cry, and the Lord hears, and delivers them out of all their
troubles, etc. many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord
delivers him out of them all, Psalm. 34. 17, 19.

I waited patiently for the Lord, etc. he brought me up also out of an horrible
pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, etc. Psalm. 40. 1, 2.

Call upon me in the time of trouble, I will deliver thee, and thou, etc. Psalm.
50. 15.

Thou who have showed me great and sore troubles, shall quicken me again, and
shall bring me up again from the depths of the earth: thou shall increase my
greatness, and comfort me on every side, Psalm. 71. 20, 21.

I will hear what God the Lord will speak: for he will speak peace to his
people: but let them not turn again to folly, Psalm. 85. 8.

The Lord is merciful and gracious, etc. he will not always chide, neither will
he keep his anger for ever, Psalm. 103. 8, 9, 13, 14.

The rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous, lest the
righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity, Psalm. 125. 2, 3.

They who sow in tears, shall reap in joy: he who goes forth and weepeth, etc.
shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, etc. Psalm. 126. 5, 6.

The Lord will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his
servant, Psalm. 135. 14.

For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger
in their destruction, Isa. 10. 25.

Though thou wast angry with me, thine anger is turned away, and thou
comfortedst me, Isa. 12. 1.

The Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in
their own land, etc. and they shall rule over their oppressors, etc. the Lord
will give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard
bondage wherein thou wast made to serve, Isa. 14. 1, 2, 3.

God has comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted, Isa.
49. 13.

The redeemed of the Lord shall return, and come with singing unto Zion, etc.
they shall obtain gladness and joy. Sorrow and mourning shall flee away, I, I
am he who comfort you, etc. hear now this thou afflicted, etc. I have taken
out of thine hand the cup of trembling, etc. thou shall no more drink it again,
Isa. 51. 11, 12, 21, 22.

For a small moment have I forsaken thee, but with great mercy will I gather
thee: in a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment, but with
everlasting kindness will I have mercy on thee, etc. Isa. 54. 7, 8.

I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit
should fail before me, and the fouls I have made. For the iniquity of his
covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, etc. and he went on
frowardly in the way of his heart. I have seen his ways, I will heal him: I
will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him, and, etc. Isa. 57. 15, 16,
17, 18.

In my wroth I smote thee, but in my favor have I had mercy on thee, Isa. 60.
10.

The spirit of the Lord God is upon me, etc. to bind up the broken hearted,
etc. to comfort all who mourn; to appoint unto them who mourn in Zion, to give
unto them beauty for ashes, and the oil of joy for mourning, etc. Isa. 61. 1,
2, 3.

I know the thoughts that I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of
peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end, Jer. 29. 10, 11.

I will heal thee of thy wounds, says the Lord, because they called thee an
outcast, saying, This is Zion whom no man seeks after, Jerem. 30. 17.

He who scatters Israel, will gather him, etc. I will turn their mourning
into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow, etc.
Is Ephraim my dear son, etc? I will surely have mercy on him, says the Lord,
etc. As I have watched over them to pluck up, and to break down, etc. so will I
watch over them to build, and to plant, says the Lord, Jer. 31. 10, 13, 20, 28.

For the Lord will not cast off for ever: but though he cause grief, yet will
he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies: for he does not
afflict willingly, Lam. 3. 31, 32.

Therefore thus says the Lord God, Now will I bring again the Captivity of
Jacob, and have mercy upon the whole house of Israel, and will be jealous for
mine holy name, after that they have born their shame, etc. Ezekiel. 39. 25, 26.

Come let us return unto the Lord: for he has torn, and he will heal us: he
has smitten, and he will bind us up, etc. Hos. 6. 1.

Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: though I fall, I shall arise, etc. I
will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him, until
he plead my cause, etc. he will bring me forth to the light, and I shall behold
his righteousness, etc. Who is a God like unto thee, who pardons iniquity,
etc? he retains not his anger for ever: because he delights in mercy, he
will turn again, he will have compassion upon us, Mic. 7. 8, 9, 18, 19.

Blessed are they who mourn, for they shall be comforted, Mat. 5. 4.

Verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye shall weep and lament, etc. but your
sorrow shall be turned into joy, etc. ye now therefore have sorrow, but I will
see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, Joh. 16. 20, 22.

And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly, Romans 16. 20.

God is faithful, etc. but will with the temptation also make a way to escape,
1 Cor. 10. 13.

God, who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver, 2 Cor. 1. 10.

It is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them who trouble
you: and to you who are troubled, rest with us, when the Lord Jeus, etc. 2
These. 1. 6, 7.

What persecutions I endured, but out of them all the Lord delivered me, 2 Timothy
3. 11.

The Lord stood with me, etc. and I was delivered out of the mouth of the Lion,
2 Timothy 4. 17.

The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations, 2 Pet. 2. 9.

11thly, That afflictions and persecutions have been the lot of Christ himself,
and of the Saints in all ages.
The Disciple is not above his Lord, nor the servant above his master: it is
enough for the disciple that he be as his Master, etc. If they have called the
Master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his
household? Fear them not therefore, Mat. 10. 24, 25, 26.

If the world hate you, you know that it hated me before it hated you, etc.
remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than the
Lord: if they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you, Joh. 15. 18, 20.

We are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men, etc. even
unto this present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are naked, and are
buffetted, and have no certain dewlling place, etc. being reviled, etc.
persecuted, etc. we are made as the filth of the world, and the offscouring of
all things unto this day, 1 Cor. 4. 9, 11, 12, 13.

There has no temptation taken you, but what is common to man, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

For we who live, are always delivered to death for Jesus sake, 2 Corinthians. 4.
11.

But as then, he who was born after the flesh, persecuted him who was after the
spirit: even so it is now, Gal. 4. 29.

Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of
Witnesses, etc. let us run with patience the race which is set before us,
looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of faith, who for the joy which was
set before him, endured the Cross, etc. for consider him who endured such
contradiction of sinners against himself, lest you be wearied and faint in your
minds, Heb. 12. 1, 2, 3.

Take, my Brethren, the Prophets who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for
an example of suffering affliction and of patience, Jam. 5. 10.

Hereunto also are ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us
an example that ye should follow his steps, 1 Pet. 2. 21.

Your adversary the Devil as a roaring Lion, etc. whom resist steadfast in the
faith; knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren who
are in the world, 1 Pet. 5. 8, 9.

How long, O Lord, etc. do thou not judge and avenge our blood on them who
dwell on the earth! and it was said unto them, That they should rest yet for a
little season, until their fellow servants also, and their brethren which
should be killed as they were, should be fulfilled, Rev. 6. 10, 11.

Fourthly, What are the Duties of the Saints, and how they ought to behave
themselves under their afflictions and sufferings, both toward God and men.
1st, Toward God.
1st, To eye God in them, afflictions being sent of him.
Joseph said to his Brethren, it was not you who sent me hither, but God, Genesis
45. 5, 8.

I will harden Pharoahs heart, that he shall follow after them, etc. Exodus 14.
4.

When Israel wanted water in the desert, they did not eye God in it, but chide
with Moses, Numb. 20. 2, 3.

But Sihon King of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the Lord thy God
hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, Deuteronomy. 2. 30.

See now that I, even I, am he, etc. I kill, and I make alive: I wound, and I
heal: neither is there any who can deliver out of my hand, Deuteronomy. 32. 39.

When Samuel had told Eli what the Lord would do against his house, he said, It
is the Lord, 1 Samuel 3. 18.

Shimei cursed David, etc. David said, So let him curse, because the Lord has
said unto him, Curse David; who then shall say wherefore? 2 Samuel 16. 6, 7, 8,
9, 10.

Satan said, Put forth thine hand, etc. Job said, The Lord gave, and the Lord
has taken, Job 1. 11, 21. Chap. 2. 5.

Afflictions comes not forth of the dust, neither does trouble come out of the
ground: etc. the chastening of the Lord: for he makes sore, and binds up: he
wounds, etc. Job 5. 6, 17, 18. chap. 9. 12.

I will say unto God, etc. wherefore contendest thou with me? Job 10. 2. chap.
30. 11.

God has overthrown me, etc. he has fenced up my way, that I cannot pass,
etc. Job 19. 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12.

When he gives quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hides his
face, who then can behold him? Job 34. 29.

I opened not my mouth, because thou did it, etc. when thou with rebukes do
correct man for iniquity, thou make his beauty to consume away, etc. Psalm.
39. 9, 11.

Thou who have showed me great and sore troubles, shall quicken me, Psalm. 71.
20.

Thou turnest man to destruction, Psalm. 90. 3.

Their enemies, he turned their heart to hate his people, and to deal subtly
with his servants, Psalm. 105. 25.

I make peace, I create evil: I the Lord do all these things, Isa. 45. 7.

I was wrath with my people: I have, etc. given them into thine hand, Isa. 47.
6.

The Lords voice cries unto the city, etc. Hear ye the rod, and who has
appointed it, Micah 6. 9.

When we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, 1 Cor. 11. 32.

Moses endured, as seeing him who is invisible, Heb. 17. 29.

Whom the Lord loves, he chasteneth, and scourges every son whom he receives,
Heb. 12. 6, 7.

See more of common calamities, Chap. 23.

2dly, To submit to God, with an humble, quiet, and silent spirit, under
troubles.
When God had slain Nadab and Abihu Aarons son, and Moses had told Aaron that
God would be sanctified in all those who came near him, etc. Aaron held his
peace, Levit. 10. 1, 2, 3.

If their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then except of the
punishment of their iniquity: then will I remember my covenant, Levit. 26. 41,
42.

Ye shall eat until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome unto you:
because that ye have despised the Lord who is among you, and have wept before
him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt? Numb. 11. 19, 20.

Do thou unto us whatsoever seems good unto thee: deliver us only, we pray
thee, this day, Judge. 10. 15.

When Samuel had told Eli all which God had threatened against Eli's house; Eli
said, It is the Lord, let him do what seems him good, 1 Samuel 3. 14, 15, 16,
17, 18.

David said, Carry back the Ark of God into the city: if I shall find favor in
the eyes of the Lord, he will bring me again, etc. But if he thus say, I have
no delight in thee: behold, here am I, let him do to me as seems good to him,
2 Samuel 15. 25, 26.

Behold, the day comes, that all which is in thine house, and that which thy
fathers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried unto Babylon:
nothing shall be left, says the Lord, etc. Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah,
Good is the word of the Lord, which thou have spoken, etc. 2 Kings 20. 16, 17,
18, 19.

When Job had received all the sad messages of his losses, he worshipped, And
said, Naked came I out of my mothers womb, and naked shall I return thither:
the Lord gave, and the Lord has taken away, blessed be the name of the Lord.
In all this Job sinned not, Job 1. 19, 20, 21.

Then said his wife to him, etc. Curse God, and die. But he said unto her, etc.
what? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil?
in all this did not Job sin, Job 2. 9, 10.

How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him;
whom, though I were righteous, would I not answer, etc? Job 9. 13. 14, 15.

Shall any teach God knowledge, seeing he judges those who are high? one dies
in his full strength (or, in the strength of his perfection), etc. and another
dies in the bitterness of his soul, and never eats with pleasure, Job 21.
22, 23, 24, 25.

God is greater than man: why do thou strive against him? for he gives not
account of any of his matters: for God speeketh once, yea twice, man perceives
it not, etc. Job 33. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15.

For he will not lay upon man more than is right, that he should enter into
judgment with God, etc. Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have born
chastisement, I will not offend: that which I see not, teach thou me. If I have
done iniquity, I will do no more, Job 34. 23, 31, 32.

The Lord answered Job, and said, Shall he who contendeth with the Almighty,
instruct him? he who reproves God, let him answer it. Then Job answered, and
said, Behold, I am vile, what shall I answer thee? I will lay my hand upon my
mouth; once have I spoken, but I will not answer, etc. Job 40. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.

I was dumb, I opened not my mouth, because thou did it, Psalm. 39. 9.

My son, despise not the chastenings of the Lord, neither be weary of his
correction: for whom the Lord loves, he corrects, Prove. 3. 11, 12. Heb. 12.
5, 6.

Woe unto him who striveth with his maker: let the potsherd strive with the
potsherds of the earth: shall the clay say to him who fashioneth it, what? etc.
Isa. 45. 9.

Cannot I do with you as this potter, says the Lord? Behold, as the clay is in
the potters hand, so are ye in my hand, O house of Israel, Jer. 18. 4, 5, 6.

Thou have chastened me, etc. after that I was instructed, I smote upon my
thigh, I was ashamed, etc. Jer. 31. 18, 19.

God tells his people in Babylon, that if they would abide there, he would
build them, and not pull them down; but if they submitted not to their
condition, but said, They would go down to Egypt where they might see no war,
etc. Then judgments should follow them thither, and there they should die, Jer.
42. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16.

It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth; he sits alone, and
keeps silence, because, etc. he puts his mouth in the dust: if so be,
there may be hope, etc. Wherefore does the living man complain, etc. for the
punishment of sins? Lam. 3. 27, 28, 29, 39.

I will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him,
Micah 7. 9.

None of these things move me, neither is my life dear unto me, so that, etc.
Act. 20. 24.

Tribulation works patience, and patience experience, etc. Romans 5. 4, 5.

Patient in tribulations, Romans 12. 12.

Neither murmur ye as some of them murmured, and were destroyed, 1 Cor. 10. 10,
11.

Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in
persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I
strong, 2 Cor. 12. 10. 2 Timothy 2. 3.

I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content, Phil. 4.
11, 12.

We our selves glory in you, etc. for your faith and patience in all your
persecutions, 2 Thessalonians. 1. 4.

Fathers of our flesh, who correct us, etc. Shall we not much rather be in
subjection to the father of spirits, and live? for they, etc. chasten us after
their pleasure; but he for our profit, Heb. 12. 9, 10. James 1. 12.

Submit your selves therefore to God: resist the Devil, James 4. 7.

The husbandman waits, etc. Be ye also patient, stablish your hearts: for the
coming of the Lord, etc. James 5. 7, 8, 11.

If ye do well, and suffer for it, and take it patiently, this is acceptable to
God, 1 Pet. 2. 20.

Humble your selves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt
you in due time, 1 Pet. 5. 6.

3dly, To confess their sins, and justify God.
If they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, with
their trespasses, etc. then will I remember my covenant, etc. Levit. 26. 40,
41, 42.

Thou art just in all that is brought upon us, for thou have done right, but we
have done wickedly, etc. Neh. 9. 33, 34, etc.

I have sinned, what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? Job 7. 20.

How should man be just with God? if he will contend with him, he cannot answer
him one of a thousand, etc. If I justify my self, mine own mouth shall condemn
me, Job 9. 2, 3, 20.

He looks unto men: and if any say, I have sinned, etc. he will deliver his
soul from going into the pit, etc. Job 33. 27, 28.

He will not lay upon man more than is right, etc. Job 34. 23.

Behold, I am vile, what shall I answer thee, etc? Job 40. 3, 4.

I uttered that I understood not: things too wonderful for me, which I knew
not, etc. I abhor my self, and repent in dust and ashes, Job 42. 3, 5, 6.

He has not dealt with us after our sins: nor rewarded us according to our
iniquities, Psalm. 103. 10.

The church in her affliction confesses her sin, Isaiah 59. 11, 12, 13, 14, 15.

Thou say, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me:
behold, I will plead with thee, because thou say, I have not sinned, Jer. 2.
35.

Only acknowledge thine iniquity, etc. Jer. 3. 12, 13.

Daniel confesses to God at large, in the time of the captivity, Dan. 9. 5, to
the 16.

Zion spreads forth her hands, etc. The Lord is righteous, for I have
rebelled, Lam. 1, 18, 20.

It is the Lords mercy we are not consumed, etc. wherefore does the living man
complain, etc? Let us search, and try our ways, and turn again, Lam. 3. 22, 39,
40.

The crown is fallen from our head: woe to us that we have sinned, Lam. 5. 16.

I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offense, and seek
my face: in their afflictions they will seek me early, Hosea 5. 15.

I will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him,
Micah 7. 9.

Do thou not fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation? and we
indeed justly, for we receive the due reward of our deeds, etc. Luk, 23. 40, 41.

See more of confession at large, Chap. 16.

See more of confession of sins, in time of common calamities, Chap. 23. One to
another, Chap. 17.

See prayer, Chap. 16.

4thly, To hold fast to God, own the Lord Jesus, his people, and ways, in the
midst of trouble, afflictions, and persecutions.
Job his wife said unto him in his great affliction, Do thou still retain thy
integrity? Curse God, and die. But he said unto her, Thou speak as one of
the foolish women speaks: what? etc. In all this did not Job sin with his
lips, Job 2. 9, 10.

All this is come upon us, yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we
dealt falsely in thy covenant. Our heart is not turned back: neither have our
steps declined from thy way. Though thou have sore broken us in the place of
dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death: If we have forgotten the name
of our God, etc. Psalm. 44. 17, 18, 19, 20.

The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy
law, etc. Many are my persecutors and mine enemies: yet do I not decline from
thy testimonies, etc. Princes have persecuted me without a cause: yet does my
heart stand in awe of thy word, Psalm. 119. 51, 157, 161.

The Lord spoke unto me, etc. and instructed me, that I should not walk in the
way of this people, saying, Say ye not a confederacy to all them to whom this
people shall say a confederacy: neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid:
Sanctify the Lord of host himself, and let him be your fear and your dread,
and he shall be for a sanctuary, Isa. 28. 11, 12, 13, 14.

When Jeremy had prophesied to Judah, then spoke the priest and the prophets
unto the princes and to all the people, saying, This man is worthy to dye: for
he has prophesied against this city, etc. Then spoke Jeremy unto all the
princes, and to all the people, saying, The Lord sent me to prophecy against
this house, etc. therefore now amend your ways, etc. But as for me, behold, I
am in your hand, do with me as seems good, etc. Jer. 26. 11, 12, 13, 14, 15.

Daniel (when a captive in Babylon) he purposed in his heart, that he would not
defile himself with the portion of the kings meat, nor with the wine which he
drank: and therefore he requested, etc. that he might not defile himself, etc.
desired pulse to eat, and water to drink, Dan. 1. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13.

When a strict law had been made by the king, that every one should fall down,
and worship the golden Image he had set up, under pain of being cast into the
fiery furnace: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego refuse to do it, and in the
presence of the king, said, We are not careful to answer thee in this matter,
etc. our God whom we serve, is able to deliver us, etc. and he will, etc. But
if not, be it known unto thee, O king, that we will not serve thy gods, nor
worship the golden image which thou have set up, Dan. 3. 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18.

When a decree was passed, that whosoever should ask a petition of any God or
man for thirty days, save of the king, he should be cast into the Lions den.
And Daniel knew that the writing was signed: He went into his house, and his
windows being open in his chamber toward Jerusalem, he kneeled upon his knees
three times a day, and prayed, and gave thanks, as he did aforetime, Dan. 6. 7,
8, 9, 10.

Ye shall be hated of all men for my names sake: but he who endures unto the
end, shall be saved, etc. He who loves father or mother more than me, is not
worthy of me, etc. And he who takes not his cross and follows after me, is
not worthy of me, etc. He who loses his life for my sake, shall find it, Mat.
10. 22, 37, 38, 39. chapter 16. 24, 25, 26.

He hears the word, and anon with joy receives it: yet has he not root in
himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution arises
because of the word, by and by he is offended, Mat. 13. 20, 21.

When Christ was taken, his disciples fled. Peter denied him: but afterward
wept bitterly for his so doing, Mat. 26. 56, 70, 72, 74, 75.

Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous
and sinful generation, of him also shall the son of man be ashamed, when he
comes in the glory of his father, etc. Mark. 8. 36.

These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended, Joh. 16.
1. Gal. 5. 11. chapter 6. 12.

When the Apostles had been commanded not to speak at all, etc. in the name of
Jesus, they say, Whether it be right in the sight of God, to hearken unto you
more than unto God, judge ye. For we cannot but speak the things which we have
seen and heard, Act. 4. 19, 20.

Again, when they were charged with preaching contrary to their command, the
Apostle said, We ought to obey God rather than men. And they preached Christ
before the council, who caused them to be beaten, and gave them a new charge
not to preach; yet they daily in the temple, and in every house, ceased not to
teach and preach Jesus Christ, Act. 5. 27, 28, 29, 30, 40, 41, 42.

None of these things move me, etc. so that I may finish my course with joy,
and the ministry, etc. Act. 20. 23, 24.

I am ready, not only to be bound, but also to die, etc. for the name of the
Lord Jesus, Act. 21. 13.

Paul before Felix said, After the way they call heresy, so worship I the God
of my fathers, Act. 24. 14.

Many of the brethren in the Lord waxing confident by my bonds, are much more
bold to speak the word without fear, etc. that ye stand fast, etc. striving
together for the faith of the Gospel, and in nothing terrified by your
adversaries, Phil. 1. 14, 27, 28.

Be thou not therefore ashamed of the testimony of the Lord, nor of me his
prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel, etc. I suffer
these things; nevertheless I am not ashamed, 2 Timothy 1. 8, 12.

If we suffer, etc. if we deny him, he also will deny us, 2 Timothy 2. 12.

-- Nor faint when thou are rebuked of him, Heb. 12. 5.

If any man suffer as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but glorify God, 1
Pet. 4. 16.

Thou shall suffer, etc. be thou faithful unto the death, and I will give thee
a crown of life, Rev. 2. 10.

See more of perseverance, Chap. 16.

5thly, To be cheerful under affliction, and rejoice to be counted worthy to
suffer for Christ.
Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vine,
etc. yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation,
Hab. 3. 17, 18.

When they shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of
evil against you falsely for my sake, rejoice and be exceeding glad, Math. 5.
11, 12.

In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer, I have overcome
the world, Joh. 16. 33.

When the Apostles had been put into the common prison, brought before the
council, and been beaten there; they departed from the presence of the council
rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name, Act. 5.
18, 27, 40, 41.

Paul and Silas being thrust into the inner prison, and their feet made fast in
the Stocks, sang praises unto God, and the prisoners heard, Act. 6. 24, 25.

Bonds and afflictions abide me, but none of these things move me, Act. 20. 23,
24.

What mean we to weep, etc. I am ready, not to be bound only, but also to die,
Act. 21. 13.

And not only so, but we glory in tribulation also, Romans 5. 3.

As sorrowful, yet always rejoicing, 2 Cor. 6. 10.

Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in
persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake, 2 Cor. 12. 9, 10.

I Paul am made a minister, who now rejoice in my sufferings for you, Col. 1.
23, 24.

Thou therefore endure hardship, as a good soldier of ^^rist. 2 Timothy 2. 3.

For ye, etc. took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in your selves,
etc. Heb. 10. 34.

Moses choosing rather to suffer, etc. esteeming the reproach of Christ greater
riches than the treasures in Egypt, Heb. 11. 25, 26.

Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees, Heb. 12. 12.

My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into diverse temptations: knowing
this, that the trying of your faith works patience, etc. Blessed is the man
who endures temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown,
James 1. 1, 2, 12.

Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial, which is to try you,
etc. but rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings: that when
his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also. If any suffer as a Christian,
let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God in this behalf: for the time
is come, when judgment, etc. 1. Peter. 4. 12. 13. 16.

Let us go forth therefore unto him, without the camp, bearing his reproach,
Heb. 13. 13.

6thly, To cry to the Lord for help, support, and salvation.
Jacob in his distress, when Esau pursued him, prayed earnestly, Genesis 32. 8, 9,
24.

Jacob in his great distress, when Joseph had kept Simeon, and required
Benjamin also, said, God almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may
send away your other brother, and Benjamin: If I be bereaved, etc. Genesis 43. 14.

The children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians marched
after them, and they were sore afraid: and the children, of Israel cried out
unto the Lord, Exodus 14. 10.

When all the waters were bitter, that the people could not drink, Moses cried
unto the Lord, Exodus 15. 23, 24, 25.

Moses cried unto the Lord, saying, What shall I do unto this people, they be
almost ready to stone me? etc. So when Amalek fought with Israel, Moses held up
his hand, and then Israel prevailed, etc. Exodus 17. 1, 2, 3, 4, 11, 12.

The Lord shall scatter you among the nations, etc. But if from thence thou
shall seek the Lord thy God, thou shall find him, if thou seek him with all
thine heart, and with all thy soul, Deuteronomy. 4. 27, 29.

When Israel were delivered into the hand of their enemies, they cried unto the
Lord, and the Lord raised up a deliverer, Judge. 3. 8, 9.

Hannah was in bitterness of soul, and prayed unto the Lord, and wept sore, 1 Samuel 1. 10, 11, 12, 13.

David in his distress, prayed the Lord to turn the counsel of Ahithophel into
foolishn^ 2 Samuel 15. 31. chapter 12. 22.

In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God, and he did hear my
voice out of his temple, 2 Samuel 22. 7.

When Jerusalem was in distress, by reason of the Assyrians, and Rabshakehs
railing and threatening: Hezekiah spread the letter before the Lord, and prayed
before the Lord, and said, O Lord God, etc. 2 Kings 19. 14, 15, 16, etc.

Hezekiah was sick unto death, etc. he turned his face to the wall, and prayed
unto the Lord, saying, I beseech thee, O Lord, etc. he wept, 2 Kings 20. 1, 2,
3.

When there came an host of One thousand thousand against Judah, Asa cried unto
the Lord his God, and said, Lord, it is nothing unto thee to help, etc. 2 Chronicles. 14. 9, 10, 11, 12.

There came a great multitude against Jehosaphat, etc. he feared, and set
himself to seek the Lord, and proclaimed a fast, etc. And Jehosaphat stood in
the congregation, and said, O Lord God of our fathers, art not thou God, etc? 2 Chronicles. 20. 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, etc.

When Manasseh was in affliction, he besought the Lord his God, etc. and prayed
unto him, and he was entreated of him, 2 Chronicles. 33. 11, 12, 13.

He hears the cry of the afflicted, Job 34. 23.

O Lord save me from all them who persecute me: and deliver me, Psalm. 7. 1.

Our fathers, etc. they cried to thee, and were delivered, etc. He has not
despised nor abhorred the afflictions of the afflicted: neither has he hid his
face from him: but when he cried unto him, he heard, Psalm. 22. 4, 5, 24. Psalm.
107. 6, 13.

I sought the Lord, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears. This
poor man cried, and the Lord heard, and saved him out of all his troubles,
Psalm. 34. 4, 6, 17. Psalm. 35.

The Psalmist prays for help and salvation in such a time, Psalm. 38. 20, 21,
22. Psalm. 39. 10, 13.

For thy sake are we killed all the day long, etc. Awake, why sleep thou, O
Lord, arise, etc. Wherefore hidest thou thy face, forgettest our affliction,
etc? Psalm. 44. 22, 23, 24, 25, 26.

Call upon me in the day of trouble, and I will deliver thee, and thou shall
glorify me, Psalm. 50. 15.

In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, Psalm.
77. 2.

In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou will answer me, Psalm.
86. 7.

I called upon the Lord in distress: the Lord answered me, and set me in a
large place, Psalm. 118. 5. Psalm. 130. 1.

The Church in her low condition prays earnestly, Look down, etc. Isa. 63. 15,
16, 17, 18, 19.

I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon, etc. Lam. 3. 55, 59,
etc.

I will go and return unto my place, till they acknowledge their offense, and
seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early, Hosea 5. 15.

When the mariners were in the tempest, they called upon their gods, and roused
up Jonah to call upon his God, if so be, God will think upon us, that we perish
not, Jonah 1. 4, 5, 6.

Jonah prayed unto the Lord his God out of the fishes belly, and said, I try,
etc. Jonah 2. 1, 2, etc.

The Ninevites prayed, etc. who can tell if God will turn, etc? Jonah 3. 8, 9.
2 Samuel 12. 22.

When Peter saw the wind boisterous, he was afraid: and beginning to sink, he
cried, saying, Lord save me. And immediately Jesus, etc. caught him, Mat. 14.
30, 31.

When the Apostles had been imprisoned, and convened before council, they lift
up their voice to God, with one accord, and said, Lord, thou art God, etc.
Behold their threatenings, and grant unto thy servants, etc. Act. 4. 24, 29, 30.

Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayers was made without ceasing of
the Church unto God for him, Act. 12. 5, 12.

Paul when he was under the buffeting of Satan, says, For this thing I
besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me, 2 Cor. 12. 7, 8.

Is any among you afflicted? let him pray, etc. Is any sick among you? let him
call for the elders of the Church, and let them pray over him, etc. And the
prayer of the faithul shall save the sick, James 5. 13, 14, 15.

See more of prayer, Chap. 16.

See more of duties in common calamities.

7thly, Not to fear, but believing, commit their case to God, and quietly wait
for his salvation.
He has said, I will never leave thee nor forsake thee. So that we may boldly
say, The Lord is my helper, I will not fear what man can do unto me, Heb. 13.
5, 6.

Isreal's impatiency in waiting for God made them quarrel with Moses, and Moses
with God, although God was in his way of delivering, Exodus 5. 21, 22, 23.

The children of Israel said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt,
have thou taken us away to die in the wilderness, etc. And Moses said unto the
people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he
shall show to you this day, etc. The Lord shall fight for you, Exodus 14. 10,
11, 12, 13, 14.

Because of Isreal's unbelief, and impatiency in waiting for God, they were not
suffered to enter Canaan, only their children, of whom they had said, They
should be a prey, they did possess the land, Deuteronomy. 1. 32, 33, 34, 35, 36, 37,
38, 39.

As an encouragement, we should remember what God has done formerly, Deuteronomy. 7.
17, 18, 19.

And David was greatly distressed, etc. but David encouraged himself in the
Lord his God, 1 Samuel 30. 6.

It may be the Lord will look on my affliction, and that the Lord will requite
good for his cursing this day, 2 Samuel 16. 12.

Elisha said, when the city was environed with enemies, Fear not, for they who
be with us, are more than they who be with them, etc. But when there was a
famine in Samaria, the king (because deliverance hastened not) said, Behold,
this evil is from the Lord: what should I wait for the Lord any longer? 2 Kings
6. 14, 15, 16, 33. 2 Chronicles. 32. 7, 8.

In the great famine of Samaria, the great lord who would not believe the
plenty the prophet had foretold, was told by the prophet that he should see it,
but not eat thereof: and so it fell out unto him, etc. 2 Kings 7. 1, 2, 17, 18,
19, 20.

Though Judah was beset by Israel, yet Judah prevailed, because they relied
upon the Lord God, etc. 2 Chronicles. 13. 14, 18.

Be not afraid, nor dismayed: for the battle is not yours, but Gods, etc. Stand
ye, and see the salvation of the Lord with you, 2 Chronicles. 20. 15, 16, 17.

To God I would commit my cause, Job 5. 8.

I waited patiently for the Lord, and he inclined to me, etc. He brought me out
of an horrible pit, Psalm. 40. 1, 2.

Why art thou cast down, O my soul? why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in
God: for I shall yet praise him, Psalm. 42. 5, 11.

Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee, Psalm. 55. 22.

Our bones are scattered at the graves mouth, etc. But mine eyes are unto thee,
O Lord, Psalm. 141. 7, 8.

If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small, Prove. 24. 10.

The fear of man brings a snare; but whosoever trusts in the Lord, shall be
safe, Prove. 29. 25.

Take heed, and be quiet: fear not, neither be faint-hearted, etc. because
Syria, Ephraim, etc. have taken evil counsel against thee, etc. I shall not
stand, Isa. 7. 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

And I will wait upon the Lord, who hides his face from the house of Jacob,
and I will look for him, Isa. 8. 17.

It shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God, we have waited for him, and
he will save us, Isa. 25. 9.

Thou will keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is staid on thee, Isa. 26. 3.

The Egyptians shall help in vain, etc. therefore have I cried, etc. their
strength is to sit still, etc. Thus says the Lord, In returning and rest you
shall be saved, in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength, etc.
Isa. 30. 7, 15.

Fear not, for I am with thee: be not dismayed, for I am thy God, etc. Isa. 41.
10, 13, 14.

Who is among you who fears the Lord, who obeys the voice of his servant,
who walks in darkness, and has no light? let him trust in the name of the
Lord, and stay upon his God. Behold all ye who kindle a fire, etc. Isa. 50. 10,
11.

Fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings, etc.
I, even I am he who comfort you. Who art thou, that thou should be afraid
of a man that shall die, etc. and forgettest the Lord thy maker? Isa. 51. 7,
12, 13.

It is the Lords mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail
not, etc. Its good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the
salvation of the Lord, Lam. 3. 22, 25, 26.

When my Soul fainted within me, I remembered the Lord, Jonah 2. 7.

The Son dishonored the father, etc. Therefore will I look unto the Lord, I
will wait for the God of my salvation, Micah 7. 6, 7.

The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble, and he knows them who
trust in him, Nahum 1. 7.

Come unto me all ye who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest,
Mat. 11. 28.

God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that you are
able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

We should not trust in our selves, but in God, etc. who delivered us from so
great a death, and does deliver: in whom we trust, that he will yet deliver, 2
Cor. 1. 9, 10.

In nothing terrified by your adversaries, Phil. 1. 28.

Be careful for nothing, but in every thing, etc. let your request be made
known unto God, Phil. 4. 6.

We our selves glory in you, etc. for your patience and faith in all your
persecutions, 2 Thessalonians. 1. 4.

Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, etc. when he suffered he
threatened not, but committed his cause to him who judges righteously, 1 Pet.
2. 21, 23.

If ye suffer, etc. be not afraid of their terror, etc. But sanctify the Lord,
etc. 1 Pet. 3. 14, 15.

Wherefore let them who suffer according to the will of God, commit the keeping
of their soul to him in well-doing, as unto a faithful Creator, 1 Pet. 4. 19.

See more of trust in God, Chap. 16.

See of waiting for God.

Secondly, The duties of saints, and how they ought to behave themselves
toward enemies and persecutors, in a time of persecution and suffering from
them.
1st, To be patient, quiet, and sober toward them: not revenge, or return evil
for evil, or reviling for reviling, but forgive them.
Joseph instead of revenging upon his brethren, for their injuring of him,
speaks kindly to his brethren, and said, Be not grieved, nor angry with your
selves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve
life, etc. So now it was not you who sent me hither, but God, Genesis 45. 6, 7, 8,

Though Saul hunted for David's life, yet would not David avenge himself upon
him, 1 Samuel 24 chapter 26.

When Shimei cursed David, he bore it quietly, and would not avenge himself, 2 Samuel 16. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11.

And afterward Abishai said to David, Shall not Shimei be put to death for
this, because he cursed the Lords anointed, etc. David said to Shimei, Thou
shall not die, 2 Samuel 19. 21, 22, 23.

O God, to whom vengeance belong, etc. show thy self, Psalm. 94. 1.

Envy thou not the oppressor, (or the man of violence), Prove. 3. 31.

Say not thou, I will recompense evil: wait on the Lord, and he shall save,
Prove. 20. 22.

Say not, I will do so to him as he has done to me: I will render to the man,
etc. Prove. 24. 29.

He was oppressed, etc. yet he opened not his mouth, etc. as a sheep, etc. so
he opened not his mouth, Isa. 53. 7.

Jeremy said, As for me, behold, I am in your hand, do with me as seems good,
etc. Jer. 26. 11, 14.

Resist not: but whosoever shall smite thee on the right cheek, turn to him the
other, Matthew. 5. 38, 39.

If ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly father will also forgive
you, Matthew. 6. 14, 15.

When one of Christ's disciples drew his sword, etc. he bid him put it up, etc.
Matthew. 26. 51, 52.

James and John said, Lord, Will thou that we command fire down from heaven,
and consume them, etc? but he turned and rebuked them: and said, Ye know not
what manner of spirit ye are of: for the Son of man is not come to desttoy men's
lives, etc. Luke 9. 53, 54, 55, 56.

Paul said to Festus (when he had said, He was besides himself); I am not mad,
most noble Festus, etc. Acts 26. 24, 25.

Recompense to no man evil for evil, etc. Avenge not your selves, but rather
give place to wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says
the Lord, Romans 12. 17, 19.

Being reviled, we bless, etc. being defamed, we entreat, 1 Cor. 4. 12, 13.

See that none render evil for evil unto any man, 1 Thessalonians. 5. 15.

Ye have condemned and killed the just, and he does not resist you, James 5. 6.

So is the will of God, that with well-doing ye may put to silence the
ignorance of foolish men, etc. Christ suffered, etc. leaving us an example that
ye should follow his steps, etc. who when he was reviled, reviled not again:
when he suffered, he threatened not, 1 Pet. 2. 15, 21, 23.

Not rendering evil for evil, or railing, etc. 1 Pet. 3. 9.

2dly, Not to desire, or rejoice in the hurt of enemies and persecutors.
David mourned and wept when Saul was slain, although he had been his deadly
enemy; hated and pursued him several years, 2 Samuel 1. 4, 5, to the end.

Abner his great enemy, who set up Ishbosheth in opposition to him, being
slain, David said, I and my kingdom are guiltless before the Lord for ever,
etc. He commands all to mourn for him: and himself mourned, followed him to his
funeral, 2 Samuel 3. 27, 28, 29, 31, 32.

So David, instead of rejoicing that Ishbosheth was slain, commands his young
men to kill those who slew him, 2 Samuel 4. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12.

When Israel had conquered Judah: the Prophet commanded them to let the
captives go, feed them, and clothe them, and not insult over them, 2 Chronicles. 28.
9, 10, 11, etc.

If I rejoice at the destruction of him who hated me, or lift up my self when
evil found him: neither have I suffered my mouth to sin, by wishing a curse to
his soul, Job 31. 28, 29, 30.

He who is glad at calamities, shall not go unpunished, Prove. 17. 5.

Rejoice not when thine enemy falls, and let not thine heart be glad when he
stumbleth: lest the Lord see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his
wrath from him, Prove. 24. 17, 18.

3dly, To pray for, and do good to Persecutors and Enemies.
If thou see the ass or ox of thine enemy going astray, thou shall, etc.
bring it back, etc. Exodus 23. 4, 5.

Miriam had spoken against Moses; yet he prays for her, against her leprosy,
Numb. 12. 1, 10, 13.

Saul said to David, Thou have rewarded me good, whereas I have rewarded thee
evil, 1 Samuel 24. 17.

Israel came and fought against Judah: and being overcome, Judah shows them
kindness, 2 Chronicles. 28.

If thine enemy hunger, give him bread to eat: and if he be thirsty, give them
water to drink, etc. Prove. 25. 21. Romans 12. 20.

Seek the peace of the City, whither I have caused you to be carried captives:
and pray unto the Lord for it, Jer. 29. 7.

I say unto you, Love your enemies: bless them who curse you: do good to them
who hate you, and pray for them who despitefully use you and persecute you,
that you may be the children of your father, etc. for he makes his sun to rise
on the evil, etc. If you love them who love you, etc. do not even the Publicans
the same? Matthew. 5. 44, 45, 46, 47, 48.

Christ said (when upon the cross) Father, forgive them, for they know not what
they do, Luke 23. 34.

They stoned Stephen; and he, etc. cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this
sin to their charge, Acts 7. 59, 60.

Paul prayed for Agrippa, that he were not only almost, but altogether as he,
except his bonds, Acts 26. 28, 29.

Bless them who persecute you, etc. Wherefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him,
etc. be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good, Romans 12. 14, 20, 21.

Being reviled, we bless, 1 Cor. 4. 12.

4thly, To use lawful, and honest means for avoiding and easing of, and
delivering themselves from afflictions and persecutions.
When Jacob heard of his brother Esau his coming against him, he was greatly
afraid and distressed: and he divided the people that was with him, and the
flocks, etc. and said, If Esau come to the one company and smite it, then the
other company which is left shall escape, etc. And he took of that which came
to his hand, a present for his brother Esau, etc. for he said, I will appease
him with the present which goes before me, etc. Genesis 32. 6, 7, 8, 13, 20.
chap. 33. 8, 13, 14.

Saul sought to smite David, etc. but he slipped away out of Saul's presence, etc.
and escaped that night. Saul also sent messengers unto David's house to watch
him, and to slay him, etc. His wife let him down through a window, and he went
and fled, and escaped, 1 Samuel 19. 10, 11, 12.

David consulted with Jonathan about his safety from Saul, 1 Samuel 20.

Elijah being threatened by Jezebel, arose, and went for his life, etc. 1 Kings
19. 2, 3.

Sanballat, etc. conspired all of them together to come to fight against
Jerusalem, and to hinder the work: nevertheless, we made our prayer unto our
God, and set a watch against them day and night, because of them, Nehem. 4. 7,
8.

Sanballat sent often to Nehemiah to come unto him, but he refused: because he
knew they thought to do him some mischief, Nehem. 6. 2, 3, 4.

Esther and Mordecai, did many things to procure the Jews escape, Esther 8.
chap. 9.

Jeremy entreated the king that he might not return to the prison, lest he
should die there, Jer. 37. 18, 20.

When Herod sought Christ to kill him, the Angel said to Joseph, etc. Arise,
and take the young child, etc. flee into Egypt, and be thou there, etc. for
Herod will seek the young child to destroy him, Matthew. 2. 13, 14, 15.

Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise
as serpents, and harmless as doves: etc. but when they persecute you in this
City, flee ye into another, Matthew. 10. 16, 23.

The Pharisees, etc. held a council against him, how they might destroy him:
but when Jesus knew it, he withdrew himself from thence, etc. he charged the
multitude not to make him known, Matthew. 12. 14, 15, 16.

When Jesus heard that John was beheaded, he departed thence into a
desert-place apart, Matthew. 14. 12, 13.

Though Christ was free, and ought not to be charged with tribute-money: yet he
said to Peter, Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go, etc. take, and
give unto them for thee and me, Matthew. 17. 24, 25, 26, 27.

When Christ had raised the Rulers daughter from the dead, he commanded that
something should be given her to eat, Mark 5. 41, 42, 43.

Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jury, because the Jews
sought to kill him, John 7. 1.

They took up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out, etc.
and so passed by, John 8. 59.

From that day forth, they took counsel together to put him to death: Jesus
therefore walked no more openly among the Jews; but went thence into a country
near the wilderness, John 11. 53, 54.

The doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews,
John 20. 19.

When Saul persecuted the Church at Jerusalem, the brethren were scattered
abroad, Acts 8. 1, 3, 4. chap. 11. 19.

The Jews laid wait to kill Paul: but their laying wait was known unto Saul,
and they watched the gates day and night to kill him: then the disciples took
him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket, etc. The Grecians went
about to slay him; which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to
Cesaria, and sent him forth to Tarsus, Acts 9. 23, 24, 25, 29, 30. chapter 19. 30,
31. chapter 17. 10, 14, 15. 2 Cor. 11. 32, 33.

Paul and Barnabas being at Iconium, the Jews and Gentiles made an assault to
use them despitefully, and to stone them: they were aware of it, and fled into
Listra and Derbe, etc. Acts 14. 1, 5, 6.

When Paul was in danger, the brethren often sent him and others away from the
place, Acts 17. 5, 10, 13.

The Captain commanded that Paul should be examined by scourging, etc. Paul
said, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and uncondemned?
which prevented his being scourged, Acts 22. 24, 25, 26, 29. chap. 16. 37, 38.
